Reviews.Title: “"Hard to beat on location & Staff"”
Reviews.Author: hindo2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in april and got a good deal through priceline, great location next to both the train station, dam square and the red light area, the hotel was excellent from courteous efficient staff all the way to a clean quiet room pros: location, staff, room, cons: none at all. My wife and I had a great time in amsterdam the hotel played its part by being a place to relax in, causing us no stress whatsoever our room overlooked several bars and maybe its early season but we never heard a single noise from the street below and we are not early risers we did not have the breakfast nor try the restaurant. We found some great bars and decent food places in the evenings just yards/metres from the hotel. We stayed in the Mauro Mansion last year and while that hotel is very good the Barbizon Palace compares very well especially on the prices we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sasha90Boston
Reviews.Content: Few web sites rate this Hotel as 5 Star as well as few reviews being on the positive quotes. Booked this Hotel with Priceline which was a good deal, pros of this place is location, concierge were excellent 5 star there. Must say this is not 5 star hotel and far from it, 3 to 3.5 at most. Not sure how web sites recommend and state as 5 star. Bathroom has no shower curtain but small glass door which cover 1/3 off the bath when shower turned on water spills on the bathroom floor (becarefull use towels not to slip, who thought of it ??!?), poor drainage, hot water is an issue, ear plugs for noise are provided but not told by any one before booking, out dated scratched up furniture in rooms (yes had to change once and were offered once more the following day as problems continued), gloomy dark in rooms, poor lighting, walls are with damages, mattress as well as the bed is noisy very uncomfortable poor bedding. And what really put me on adge is when during upgrade to other rooms occurred the front desk were hustling me to charge 35 Euros and then to 25 Euros per night as if it was my fault the quality is not to standarts stated. After I've come back home to US called Priceline which were able to contact the Nh Barbizon Hotel who emailed an apoology and future stay coupon .. REALLY ... to STAY AGAIN .. REALLY ??!!? 5 STAR .. ????? Think or other chain hotels to compare Sheraton, Hilton, Merroitt, Sofitel, most of these are 4 star and if any one stayed there will agree Nh Barbizon is 3/3.5 star at most. Priceline must do better for long time customer !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dvdstv
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this Hotel Its very handy first of all for central Amsterdam including the station [ opposite ] and I could walk to my meetings from here Check-in was excellent and the only small problem I had during my stay was resolved quickly Perhaps the rooms are a little dated with rather drab decor but apart from that was good value for money in a central location Please consider the wonderful Michelin starred restaurant next door - Vermeer - and the hotel had a decent bar too

Reviews.Title: “Good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Timo S
Reviews.Content: Spent there three nights during a business trip. Breakfast was good, rooms cozy and service excellent. Paid internet connection didn't have any problems. The only complaint I had was the noise coming from the street every night. The location is perfect if you want to spend time downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: caymansilvas
Reviews.Content: Tried to book a hotel in Amsterdam for Easter weekend about a month before our stay. So much was unavailable and finally took a shot a Priceline with a 4 star. Said I was upgraded to a 5 star. This is not a 5 star hotel. More like 3 1/2. The location is great. Very convenient. Lobby is beautiful. Staff was friendly when approached. We requested a 2 bed room and were told the only room available with 2 beds was smoking. We took a chance with it, and it wasn't so bad in that category. But the room was so disappointing. Old and dated. Just state. Two bed pillows were like sofa throw pillows. We had the top floor so walking down the halls we had nice views of Amsterdam, but the room itself had no view. It is a convenient walk from Centraal Station. And I felt safe walking around the area by myself both during the day and evening. They just need to update the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pre-night stay for river cruise”
Reviews.Author: LLANCE_KCMO
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and my husband and I stayed in this hotel for two nights prior to our River cruise down the Rhine. The location was fabulous - directly across from the train station and easy access to restaurants, trams, etc. The staff was VERY helpful, courteous, and efficient. Check in was FAST. Our room faced the interior of the building, so no view, but that's what we wanted so we wouldn't be disturbed by street noise on the other side. Our room was very cute - it was on two levels with the bathroom and dressing area on one level, and then three steps down was the bed and office area of the room. Bed was very comfy. Room was clean and up to date. Plenty of hot water in the shower - and there was tons of counter space in the bath. For a European hotel, there was plenty of room overall. We would easily recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel! Best Location in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Marcel G
Reviews.Content: Right in the city centre of Amsterdam. Near train station and at creepage distance of many hundreds of bars and restaurants. Friendly and efficient staff and excellent concierge assistance. Skip breakfast in the hotel and stroll to one off the many the nearby breakfast restaurant. Early arrival? just drop your lugage at the reception and check-in later. Good and pleasant hotel and perfect beds! I will return again. Carpark at the hotel, you must see this!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: Elke151107
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel one Saturday night and it was fine. I had been reading bad reviews, but it's really wasn't bad. Ok, there were some mildew stains in the bathroom and we could hear the noise from trams passing by on the street in front of the hotel, but other than that it was fine. Friendly staff, great location. It's expensive, but in line with other Amsterdam hotels of this quality on this location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a palace”
Reviews.Author: FirstLast34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times - on the edge of the red light area. Reception is impressive with friendly staff. Rooms are a little dated, however, on one occasion I did get a guided tour of various rooms for me to select from! I would stay here again, but I wouldn't expect luxury from the 5* and the name.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Weekend”
Reviews.Author: terry s Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 5*Hotel, 5*Service, 5*Staff, 5*Treatment, 5*Food, What's to say a great weekend and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: travellady83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights and was not sorry that I booked this hotel. It is steps away from the central train station, so it was convenient for the airport and other travel during my stay. I requested a quiet room and was given an inner courtyard room. I slept well and didn't awaken until after 9:30 the first day and 10:30 the next. I made it down to breakfast only once. It's pricey, but they do have a lot to offer: the usual continental items plus eggs, waffles, meats, etc. Is it worth $21-$25? No, not by U.S. standards, but this is Europe and it's expensive to eat here, unless you want to eat street food or dine in dicey restaurants. I did order a cheese sandwich for dinner in the restaurant one night. It was good, but it took forever to get it. The hotel staff was very helpful when I had questions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam. You can walk to anywhere or hop on a tram across the street at the train station. Note: The free WiFi in the lobby is SLOW! They really should give you free WiFi in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Bad quality price/services”
Reviews.Author: Valentin S
Reviews.Content: The location is quite good, the hotel is not so bad, however to have to pay extra for the WiFi that mostly does not work, and to pay extra for the gym that is very poorly equipped seems a little unfair, given the price of a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night between a trip to Madrid and heading back to the states. Great location! I do have to say I travel a lot for work and this hotel had one of the nicest front desk staff I have ever seen. They remembered my name when I came back! Room was fine, clean, comfy. I would of course stay here time and time again....and you should too!

Reviews.Title: “They did it for me.... well done Barbizon”
Reviews.Author: horizon t
Reviews.Content: What a great time we had here, great hotel, very clean, amazing staff - We stay in hotels very often but this place jumps out as a shining light of how hotels should operate... On entry looks a bit corporate but don't let this ruin the experience this hotel team provide, nothing is too much trouble for them, help with restaurants, booking trips, room service... all amazing. There is a small nice bar in the hotel where you can sit and watch one of the alley ways leading into the alleys so great for people watching.. The hotel breakfast is pricey at 25 euro's and whilst is very very good there are some nice pancake shops within 2 mins walk from the hotel where a good fill can be had for half that.. We stayed here after having some bad experiences with hotels in Amsterdam but his place wins hands down, Just 2 mins walk across the plaza from Central Station - ask for a room overlooking the plaza... We used the Spa which is pricey but your well looked after and felt got reasonable value for money

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: stockholmqueen
Reviews.Content: Booked via internet on a 2 night best room available deal for a brilliant price. We arrived early morning & wasnt expecting to check in but they gave us our room straight away without hesitation. Check in friendly & quick. Our room was a good size & overlooked the front of the hotel so we did get some noise from outside. Some have commented on the dated furniture but we think it suited the hotel overall. The whole place is very impressive & its location is fantastic so you are not far away when you want to return your purchases before continuing sighseeing. I cannot say about the food as we did not eat in. We did have a drink in the bar which was a little pricy but on par with any other hotel. Check out again went smoothly & they let us put our bags in the luggage room as we were not leaving till the evening ferry. We wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IowaMusictravel
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel. It did not include breakfast or free internet (except in the lobby), but it was a great room, a beautiful lobby, and hotel staff were very helpful. The location was amazing - I walked out of the train station and there it was! I loved the brand of soap/shampoo, etc. Bathrobe provided in the closet, etc. It felt very luxurious to me. I have no idea why anyone would not call this a five-star hotel. I thought it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beware when contemplating booking here!”
Reviews.Author: FLTraveler32765
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Priceline for a bid of $120 plus tax and service charges. Although it was advertised as a five-star hotel, it didn't come close (it's a three-star at best). To be fair, the central location was outstanding and convenient, within walking distance of all public transit and the central city. Aside from some minor inconveniences like no heat in the room and having to pry open the tub drain, the '`upgraded" room we got was just above the street, with two tiny twin beds. I was charged an additional 80 euros for a third bed (cot with a thin mattress), which effectively doubled the rate! You will much prefer the Doubletree directly across the square, where I was able to book a nicer room with a better view for 169 euros total (no surcharge for the third bed) plus tax and service charges...plus earn Hilton points. If you are bidding for a five-star hotel in the Amsterdam city center, you'll notice this hotel's rack rate is considerably less than all others shown. Go down one star and bid $100...or take my advice about the Doubletree, especially if you are a Hilton Honors member

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gillok1
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for the weekend last week and can't really fault the place. Location was ideal, rooms were clean and spacious enough. A bit dated but this wasn't a problem. The breakfast was expensive but there are lots of places to eat nearby so this was ok. All in all we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but no better”
Reviews.Author: chriswendyandsam
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night break with my wife and 3 year old at this hotel. The location is good very central and the hotel has some indications which represents its 5 star rating. The lobby and breakfast for example. Ok value for money. Comfy room. However there was a number of problems the restaurant service is slow at best waiting over an hour for meal. The menu is the shortest I have ever seen but food is good. Hair dryer in room didn't work and wire was hanging off also a plug hanging off wall in fairness I only raised these when left. The lift system which requires key is frustrating as often doors close and you are still trying to get your key to activate the lift. I would return here though

Reviews.Title: “Beauty & Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Eastendboyz
Reviews.Content: First time staying here. It was recommended and I'm glad we listened. The staff are attentive, pleasant and very very welcoming, (and good looking too!!) On check in we were asked if we wanted a view (Yes please!!) No extra charge!! The room was more like a suite. Based on 2 levels (!?) very comfortable, spacious and a view of Damrak & Centraal station. One thing though, the double glazing is not actually double glazing, it's quite thick panels of glass screwed over the outside windows. Other reviewers have complained of the noise of trams, Hmm! Depends on what time you get up I suppose. They dont actually start until about 7 ish I believe by which time most people are up for breakfast. However being night owls and not going to bed until the (very) small hours we didn't notice them until we woke around mid-day (LOL). So try to ignore other comments, Seriously, they're not that noticeable. The hotel bar is a nice place to meet before heading out but is somewhat dimly lit but that didn't really matter as we weren't staying long. The foyer of the hotel is just magnificent, black and white marble and very grandiose. Personal and special thanks to Johnathan on reception who very kindly helped me with trying to check in on line and very graciously offered us late check out (He'd seen us roll up in the early hours). Many Thanks indeed. Gold star :) For the Brits out there,turn left and left again outside the hotel on to Waarmoestraat, 150 yds down on the left try Teddy's Corner. See Josephine (Essex Lass). Anyway, On the whole This is a top quality hotel with top quality furnishing and decor and the best staff you could ever come across. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sverre H
Reviews.Content: The location is central and only a couple of hundred meters from the central station. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was very nice. The computers on the hotel are running very slowly, so bring your own computer if you need access to internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excited for the Upcoming Stay”
Reviews.Author: Drew L
Reviews.Content: I'll be staying at your property from Jun 1 - Jun 3, 2012. From the reviews it appears that some rooms are definitely better than others, i'm hoping that you can pre-assign me an acceptable room to help make may stay as pleasant as possible. Appreciate the help, Dank u!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mrwalkerLondon
Reviews.Content: Surprised about all the negative comments about this hotel, we opted for a Hotel close to the station so we could just cross the road and check in. The alternative is being one of the many tourists, wondering aimlessly around Amsterdam dragging their luggage. The hotel itself offered great service, the bar and food was top quality. The room (No247) was spacious, clean and worth the money, Â£105pn. My only negative was the price of the breakfast, 63 euros per morning. A bit steep bearing in mind I only had a coffee and a slice of toast. The wife and child had more but still a bit expensive. Alternatively, there is a "cheaper" cafe next door to the left, there is also an option to use the free coffee facility in the foyer, have take away cups with lids too. There were a pair of ear plugs next to the bed which raised an eyebrow but the noise from outside was ok....this isn't the cotswolds afterall. Another reason we chose this price hotel is because we had a 5 yr old with us so we wanted to guarantee a certain standard of fellow guest, had we have been on our own then we'd have risked it elsewhere probably. Make the most of your days if you're with the kids, be out for 9-10am because its not child friendly at night. Amsterdam, very expensive place. Budget for this and you'll be ok. We spent around Â£125 per day and we didnt push the boat out. Its equally expensive further out from the town center so we just accepted it! Beer around 6euros, in a typical cafe 2 x half lager and a hot chocolate 12 euros. Main meals around the 20 euro mark.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy Sundays!”
Reviews.Author: Meggies63
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Amsterdam a few times previously, thought we'd try this hotel for a change. Got a good deal with EasyClik Travel (who?) via Trivago. Hotel perfectly situated, very easy to find a stone's throw from Central Station. On check-in we were informed we had a king size room and had a choice of a view over the canal or a quiet room overlooking an inner courtyard. We opted for quiet. And boy it was quiet! Bliss. Although earplugs were provided just in case !! Lovely big room, king size bed, free safe, bathrobes slippers, tea coffee etc etc. Nice size bathroom, plenty of toiletries, good hot water supply, nice towels. TV was a bit old and "wobbly" but had BBC1 and BBC2. A really nice unexpected extra was "Lazy Sunday" where you don't have to check out until 5pm so no worries about getting the most out of your weekend. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent upscale hotel near Amsterdam Centraal”
Reviews.Author: Mark7735
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe room here for three nights. Very nice hotel and very convienient for exploring Amsterdam and being near the Centraal station. THe hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We are well rested here”
Reviews.Author: chernova_st
Reviews.Content: The Barbizon Palace hotel in Amsterdam is located opposite the Amsterdamâ€™s Central Station, so we can easily find it. The hotel is a five-minute minute walk away from Dam Square. The Red Light District is a short distance too. Our room (standard) was spacious, well-furniture and very comfortable, bathroom with bath/shower combination, with coffee/tea making facilities, mini bar, Cable TV, Wi-Fi, iron & ironing board and a bathrobe with slippers. Besides in the hotel we used a fitness room and sauna with wellness area. There are 2 luxury restaurants - Restaurant Vermeer - winner of several international Michelin awards, Hudson's Terrace & Restaurant. So if you have money, you should stay in this hotel to feel Amsterdam with much more pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location - friendly team”
Reviews.Author: rudie_11
Reviews.Content: Efficient check in / out; extended Sunday check out was very helpful. Friendly staff. Old TV with bad quality screens. Excellent breakfast Excelent location - next to CS train station.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome and professional service”
Reviews.Author: GUNESZaventem
Reviews.Content: I and my family were welcomed with very personal and warm approach at NH Barbizon Palace. It started with the bellman while parking our car, and went on with the reception with friendly welcome. Concierge with their expertize in the city, helped us enormously with great patience taking the best possible tours and visit to museums. Very professional approach continued during lunch; eventhough it was the end of the service. And the check out and the bellman during our check out were again in the same good level of service; asking our feedbacks on our trip and the service in the hotel. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel With A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: five_star49
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Amsterdam, located opposite the main train station. Just about every site you would want to see in Amsterdam is within walking distance. We arrived at the hotel very early, well before check in. We had two rooms booked, one was ready so they let us check in straight away which was a great help. The rooms were spacious and well equiped, all be it a little dated. Everything worked, and was extremely clean. We checked out on a Sunday, and much to my surprise we didn't have to check out until 4pm. This again was a great help as our flight didn't leave until late evening. All in all this is a great hotel, great price, and a even better location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Service and Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Minnz
Reviews.Content: When you step out of the station - take a look around, and you'll spot the hotel (the big signs over the roof of the building are prominent) and walk to it. When we reached the hotel, we were treated really well throughout our stay. Always greeted with a smile, and "Have a nice day". Had the room cleaned both days we stayed, and the cleaner was really cheerful and friendly, even asking how yesterday went. Ok - the room... Well, I can see how some people have faulted it due to the old fashioned stylingâ€™s - but we didn't mind at all. The beds were clean, spotless - comfy. The bathroom was well lit, clean and well - did what it said on the box and it was all good. We actually walked in and thought - "this is nice!". We were on the fourth floor, and towards the back of the hotel ( I think). Any advice? Well I would ask for a room without the view, that is if you are a light sleeper, as we did and we didn't hear anything. It was a Saturday, so we didn't want to be kept awake with the rest of Amsterdam out partying (well..after we had finished our bit that is!). We went as a couple, and we managed to have a great time wandering the streets and always finding our way back (thanks to the hotel location) and we were in the middle of decent coffee shops (they need to be within walking distance!) and the tourist bits. Oh yeah, donâ€™t eat the waffles and cherry sauce for breakfast â€“ youâ€™ll only miss them when you leave! All in all, great hotel â€“ just book it already, you wonâ€™t fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for our Amsterdam trip”
Reviews.Author: Heather7191
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbizon Palace for our stay in Amsterdam and I could not fault it. The staff were impeccable and the room was spacious, comfortable and very luxurious. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal Hotel for Exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel ideal for our stay in Amsterdam. Getting there couldn't have been easier as it is only a short walk from the Central Station. Its location is also ideal for exploring the city as most of the main attractions are within walking distance of the hotel. The restaurant was excellent with both the quality of the food and the standard of service being first class. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous and seemed proud of this historically unique hotel. The only thing that prevents me giving five stars is that our room, although clean and with the facilities you would expect, needed some updating. Having said that, this would not prevent us staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: b-squared555
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located across from the main train station and at the gateway to shopping, restaurants, and the famed Red Light district. Everything you need is just steps away. You can even walk to the flower market and most of the museums within about 20-25 minutes if you enjoy walking, (and don't get too distracted by all the great shopping districts you pass through)--and Amsterdam is a great city for it. As for the hotel itself, the service was pretty good--(had to call twice to fix something in the room at one point) but the people were friendly and willing to help. We were in a "suite" which was about the size of an average room in the U.S..--so it was nice, especially for most hotels in Europe. Very quiet and relaxing and in good condition, and the bed, in spite of being a smallish Queen was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ALANDAVIES_12
Reviews.Content: Just got back form four day break staying at this hotel,we found the staff very friendly and helpful large bedroom and kept very clean,excellent breakfast,and the location was very good. would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel of choice”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_OFarrell
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times as our preferred option in Amsterdam. Admittedly the price does help and you can usually find a good deal here. The rooms are clean and location is great. We have occasionally gone off piste and usually regretted it. Perhaps not the five star experience you get from other hotels but a sound option, we've never had a bad experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Thekman1964
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline for 65 Euro per night for 4 nights. Turned out to be a good deal. This is not a five star hotel. Not in their wildest dreams, however at 65Euro per night it is well worth it. The decor at reception and in the foyer is vastly superior to what you will see in the rooms. As usual I might add with alot of these "5 Star" joints. The rooms are clean though. For some reason they only have the most rudimentary of TV channel selection. Bathroom flooded whenever it was used, due to a poorly sized shower door, but that didn't detract too much. Avoid room 143 if it is a bother for you. Location is unbeatable. Returning for a repeat stay soon.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5*”
Reviews.Author: Kelly U
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, very close to central station. The reception area of the hotel is very nice, and what you would expect for a 5*, rooms are much more modest/basic. However- we had an unexpected visitor in the form of a mouse! Although we were not massively impressed with this the duty manager that came to deal with it was nice and clearly experienced in removing mice! He told us that it is quite normal in Amsterdam to get mice and didn't see it as a big deal- his relaxed attitude helped and we decided not to complain when we left. Overall, I think the hotel is ok. Given the price we were relatively satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 day Anniversary Break”
Reviews.Author: Shazza1505
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip for our anniversary. I was rather concerned with the negative reviews for this hotel prior to booking but upon arrival I found the reviews wrong. The hotel lobby was clean and spacious and the staff and concierge were very attentive. The room was very spacious with a king size bed, we had a lovely quiet room as this is what I had requested. Prior to departure they made sure that the airlines were ok to fly to LHR and even let me check out 1 hour later. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others. If ask for a quiet room they do their best t accomodate you Thank you Robin, Jonathon & Daniel for always being on hand. Fantastic Service

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5 star but overall decent safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: getupanggo
Reviews.Content: Arrived wednesday 5th January 2012.. The hotel was easy to find just acrooss the road and over the canal from Central station. A good 5 minute walk. I had only needed to have a single room as I was on business but when booking (via expedia) I had to have a double room as no option for single traveller. The hotel lobby was clean and spacious and the staff and concierge attentive. There was a business area where you could sit down at a desk or on a couch get free internet, the internet in the room was chargeable. The bedroom was ok but I feared the worse when I saw compllmentary ear plugs by the side of the bed. However it was quiet but that may have been due to the fact that it was -7c outside and midweek so they were less revellers about If you are a light sleeper i suggest you ask for an inner facing room not one that looks over the road at the side of the hotel. Breakfast was 25Euro if you paid on the day, or 21.50 Euro if you preordered it, There was no option for a continental breakfast- only full English. The breakfast was poor for a 5 star hotel. The scrambled eggs on the buffet were overcooked the cheese on the platters looked hard around the edges and looked like processed Kraft cheese slices. Coffee you have to help yourself from a coffee machine. In a 5 star hotel your tea or coffee should really be served to you, or brought in coffee or tea pots pots. I ended being up and down like a brides nightey. I did not notice they had cereal until i was leaving as this was located on a separate small table at one side of the room. As a tip if you want to save money have breakfast at coffeebar at side of hotel. However as I had not come solely to be fed this was only a small blip in the hotels overall performance.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the 5-star rating!”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: Let's get one thing straight - this isn't a 5-star hotel. Turn up expecting 5-star luxury and you'll be disappointed. However, neither does it charge 5-star prices. My wife and I spent three nights here in January. Having the combined directional senses of an orange we were pleased to see the hotel from the train as we pulled into Amsterdam's main railway station. The reception area was most impressive, the staff courteous and helpful. 5-star all the way. Then we found our room. And that's where things go 3-star. Alerted by previous reviews, we'd asked for a quiet room and we got it. Perfect. It was clean too, and the bed was comfy, but it was so, well, tired. It would be an exageration to say we spent our evenings waiting for the valves to warm up on the TV but the last time I saw such an aged device was on the Antiques Roadshow. So why does this review give a score of 5/5? Because we paid peanuts for our stay, because the location is brilliant, because the room provided us with exactly what we wanted and because the staff couldn't be faulted. We ate in the hotel only once and that was for breakfast. We'd heard it was a tad pricey but we thought it might be something mindblowing. It wasn't. It was a let down so we ate out after that. In summary, ignore the 5-star rating, accept you'll be staying in a well-priced 3-star hotel, ask for a quiet room, skip the breakfast and you won't be disappointed. We weren't.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel great staff excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ennui132000
Reviews.Content: 2 min walk from the central station, ideally located for all tram and bus services. i wouldnt pay for the room upgrade its not worth it. breakfast was nice, check in staff helpful

Reviews.Title: “The apartments of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndiJ_AJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec for 10 nights in the Barbizon apartments which are part of the hotel although just around the corner, they have their own street entrance but all of the hotel's amenities including room service etc are available to the apartment guests. We arrived at 6am in the morning after a long flight and were given our room after a swift check in which was lovely because we were very tired. It was nicely appointed with a bed/lounge room, bathroom and a little kitchenette which is good. They provide bathrobes and toiletries which smell divine but not kitchen essentials like a washing up cloth nor dishwashing liquid. But there is a supermarket just down the little street so that wasnt a problem. Also bizarrely for a hotel only an initial toilet roll, when you use that you have to purchase your own in the apartments! The heating was too hot (typical of all European hotels in winter) but we turned it off and you can open the window up which lets in air which is good. The street is noisy until well into the night but the hotel provides earplugs which are welcome! A great selection of tv channels to be had and the wonderful Dutch habit of showing the programs in the language they were written in (so a lot of English ones) and then they subtitle the Dutch in which is great if you want to watch something other than BBC news which at some many hotels seems to be the only English channel on offer. So thanks for that Dutch tv! The hotel will do laundry for you (at a cost) or there is a small laundrette around the corner if you want to do your own. You are just across the road from the Central Station and five minutes walk from the Dam Square both of which are handy but only one street away from the Red Light District and very central to several Coffee Shops and Pubs so be aware that its a noisy location with a lot of people always about. The staff of the hotel are friendly, very knowledgeable and all speak a number of languages. They will help you with tours or directions or simply tell you about the city's history if that's what you want. They will lend you an umbrella if it's raining as well which is handy. We would stay here again because we like apartment living when we go overseas and this fits the bill nicely. Just be aware though if you like the sound of the apartments and you have mobility issues they might not be suitable because they are stair accessible only. The hotel has lifts, the apartment block does not.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmannLeicester
Reviews.Content: i was rather concearned with the negative reiviews for this hotel,prior to booking but as we were only staying in amsterdam for one night i booked anyway.we arrived at the hotel at 10.30am and were given a room straight away even though check in was 3pm.we were also advised that sunday checkout was at 5pm our flight was at 9.30 pm so this was a bonus.i have stayed at the crowne plazza before and would say the service at this hotel was second to none.would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike100274
Reviews.Content: I booked this online and it said it was a 5 star hotel. I've stayed at the Ritz and I've stayed at Motel 6 and this was somewhere in between. I would probably rate it a 4 or maybe 3.5 stars. The location is great, but in Amsterdam people come to smoke weed and play in the Red Light District. Unfortunately, this attracts a lot of scum to the city. This is too bad because Amsterdam is such an incredible place. Being that this hotel is so close to the action it attracts a lot of this scum. This staff, which is top-notch, is almost unable to do anything about the problems from other guests. The rooms and amenities were just ok, hence the lower rating. I would not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable quarters off Red Light Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: snowgrassflats
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great and convenient location tucked between Centraal Station and the Red Light District. Free wifi in lobby. Charming room done in a split floor style (because the hotel is a conglomeration of old row buildings, I believe there is quite a variability between rooms, especially as the heights of the each building do not quite match up). Room relatively clean and not cramped. Cons: Cheap mattress. My allergies started acting up, especially after I turned on the forced air heater. Overall it was a not a bad base to explore Amsterdam, although I suspect any location within Amsterdam can be considered "a great location." If you can get a good deal on this place, I would recommend it. As with other reviews, however, the 5* rating is awfully generous.

Reviews.Title: “My Old Flame”
Reviews.Author: thel4mb
Reviews.Content: This 5* Hotel lies opposite the central station. Several small houses were put together to this huge hotel - as well as the old St. Olof Chapel which is now the conference center. The Rooms are large a bit worn but still nice. Tip: Get a the special cocktail of the day at the bar for cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a prefect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaLaL_ShaNe3a
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night as many people mention that the hotel in a perfect location just in fron of the train station we booked a deluxe room the room was spacious with a nice view to the train station we didnâ€™t got any problem with noise our room was in 4th floor the furnisher was to old and tired but was really clean and comfortable and all the facility worked well all the hotel staff was really friendly and helpful the check in and check out took seconds we really enjoy our stay in this hotel and for sure we will stay again here and I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but no access to facilities”
Reviews.Author: Bkirkham
Reviews.Content: Was a good hotel but pretty basic. Although now of the facilities were included. You have to pay 10 euro for Internet every 24 hours and 12 euro everything you want to use the fitness centre. This should be included. Plenty of over options around to choose for hotels

Reviews.Title: “didn't like”
Reviews.Author: nicolasdenice
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are going to see "nasty place" of amsterdam=)..We stayed one week , 2 minute walk from the station and close to everything. Check in was late, about 4 o clock. The room was average and little old fashioned. When i came in my room, the bathroom was not really clean.Didnt like this hotel, only good location thats all, stuff was ok. Expensive WIFI, 10 â‚¬ for 24 h, expensive breakfast 25 â‚¬, and about 10â‚¬ near the hotel. I give not more then 3 star. Restaurant was horrible. So if u want to spend your money for nothing stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: mani235
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for two nights. Staff was very cooperative. Loation is very convenient for the tousrists. It is just 3 minutes walk away from the central station, 5 minutes from the red light district and 10 minutes from The Dam Square. You can find quite a few coffee shops and restaurants nearby. We booked a deluxe room, which was quite big as compared to the usual european hotel rooms. The room was very clean and not noisy at all. The only disappointment we had was the arrangement for new year's eve done by the hotel staff. They gave us party tickets for "The Super Club" (Euro 60 each). It was our worst experience as the club management did not let us enter the club till 01:15 in the morning. So we celebrated our new year's eve on the street waiting for the management to open the door. It was pathetic. So never go to that club. However, the hotel management returned us 50% of the ticket price. Overall, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: julza
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in amsterdam so was a great choice for us, 2 minute walk from the station and close to everything. Check in was a bit of a pain, was supposed to be 3 o'clock and the room wasn't ready till 4 so there was a lot of hanging around. Cant really complain though, their endless sundays meant we didnt have to check out till 5pm the next day. The room was quite nice but a little old fashioned, could do with a revamp. A nice but expensive stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - expensive for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: naughtybutnice
Reviews.Content: I will keep this brief, the hotel looks impressive from outside and inside the lobby and restaurant looked great too - menu pricey and we didnt eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food. The location is perfect right opposite the train station, and 2 minutes away from the sex shops, bars and some great restaurants/take aways. Approx 5-10 minutes to Dam Square and all the shopping. Amsterdam is an amazing city, and i had a great time although would love to go back in the summer months and visit the fields full of tulips, Anne Franks house and see a few of the other tourist attractions! and had The staff in the hotel were friendly, proffessional and our room was lovely, bathroom was tiny but the bedroom had a huge king size bed and had wooden beams which gave the room character, the view was pretty rubbish/almost non existant. But as we were only in the room to sleep and it was only a short visit to Amsterdam this didnt bother us. Hotel was nice but quite expensive, would i stay here again? Yes defo but only if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Joan M
Reviews.Content: Great location ..........that's about the only positive thing ........room was average and very cold no heating had to ask for bathrobes carpet was dirty and bathroom very dated would not call this hotel a 5 star .........more a 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star Experience.”
Reviews.Author: KERF_Worldwide
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times now and overall there is no way that this could really be called a five star hotel. As is typical for hotels in Amsterdam, Room Quality varies wildly and a lot of it depends on what you have a view of. Twice in this hotel I have had a boxy room whose windows looked over filthy rooftops and brick walls. The Reception and communal areas are non existent and the lift is ridiculously slow. There was only one time where I would say that this hotel was worth the money that I paid. Again this came down to which room I was assigned. The last time I was there I got a huge room on the first floor that had amazing views over the street that runs down the sie of the hotel. It might not have been for everyone but it was a unique perspective on Amsterdam. The Concierge at this Hotel seem to be the nicest staff members. It is fine, but it absolutely is not five stars. It is in a great location however and in Amsterdam having somewhere that one can easily navigate back to can be essential.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience in Barbizon.”
Reviews.Author: Xulong Z
Reviews.Content: We are from China, and we stayed in NH Barbizon Palace hotel for 10 days, it is a very good hotel, perfect location which next to the central station and shopping center. The room is nice, well cleaned, and the old fashioned style looks so nice and special. The staffs there are very nice, kindly and helpful, especially the Chinese Housekeeping supervisor, she helped us a lot, and gave us a very nice city tour during her free time. Overall, I was very satisfied and strongly recommend this hotel. I will go there next time definitely.

Reviews.Title: “A SAD EXPERIENCE AT WHAT IS CALLED BARBIZON PALACE 5 STARS!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotelinspecytor
Reviews.Content: First, and foremost, there is a time old expression, all that glitters is not gold. Please keep this now in your mind. A beautifully gift wrapped box may contain a sad surprise!, and the box is called the Barbizon Palace 5 Star Hotel in Amsterdam. The facade outside is splendid and inviting, walk through the main entrance and you are greeted with a plush marble bright modern interior, with a cross keys uniformed Porter and delightful and impeccably dressed receptionsits. There is now another phrase, to take into consideration, known as talk the walk. This they do splendidly.One question thgey continually say to checking in guests, would you like a quiet room, or a room over the traffic. Guess the answer of the guest, more fool them. Knowledge is wonderful in hindsight. Once out of the elevator, going to the rooms, you enter a different world, a world set back some 30 years in creature comforts, old and used. The beds are worn out old spring mattresses, sagging from use, bring some string to secure your body, or you will play rollover; the carpets are dusty and worn, windows dirty, curtains probably never seen a wash, air condition guaranteed to blow dust.The pillows are all of duck feathers, birds long time migrated, and are DNA lump remains. The televisions are 1970`s large box style. Please continue, the best is yet to come. Now for breakfast, the charge is 23 Euros. What do you receive, well, simply put, no waiter service, you take your own coffee from a machine, and help yourself to a limited buffet, very limited at that. If you are a vegetarian, or dont eat pork, but love your eggs in the morning, the Hotel has a non brainer for you. The eggs, all fried or scrambled are kept in a large bowl, with an open pull lid, divided into 2 sections. You guessed it, bacon steaming one side with pork sausages and eggs the other. Close the lid, you get smoky porky bacon eggs fit for a vegetarian, with the steam passing and dripping fat over the eggs. Question, is this, or not a no brainer, and for a 5 star hotel?? Want to complainm, go find someone. Now, later in the day, you fancy a beer. So, in the rear of the foyer is a bar. The barman will take a glass stick it over a soapy wash brush, turn it over still with soap suds in and put the draught beer in, the soap suds are free, they just dont care. Fancy the Health Club, they charge 12.50 for a day pass, located in the basement, forget it. Location superb, 5 minutes to the cente and Railway. Overrall star rating 3 Star, at 5 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gtsint
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights during a Business Trip. The Hotel is at a great location right across of the Central Railway Station. You can walk to almost everywhere in Amsterdam Centrum by there. The Hotel reception and lobby is decorated excellent - modern stylish. Breakfast was great, above average. Rooms very spacious although more traditionally decorated. Personnel excellent. I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone although pricing can be very high at certain periods (like what I paid, 300Euro/night). Internet not free at rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel, convienently located”
Reviews.Author: Lynne G
Reviews.Content: We arrived late due to weather conditions and were exhausted, to be grated by awesome staff members. The airline lost our luggage and the staff provided most of our needs without charge. Very easy access to this beautiful city. free upgraded room turned our day around! Great room, service and elegance makes this a must stay next time we are in town!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Prague, Hlavni Mesto Praha, Czech Republic
Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: I didn't have any expectations for this hotel especially because it was located so close to central station and adjacent to the red light district. I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby is spacious, clean and modern. The rooms are good size, carpeted, with high ceilings and exposed wood beams. The beds are nothing to write home about, not the most comfortable but not terrible either. The annoying thing is that Wifi is only free in the lobby for 30 minutes; in the rooms you have to pay. The location is great, close to all forms of transportation and there are a couple decent breakfast spots/cafes within a two-three min walk if you don't want to eat in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a weekend in The Dam...”
Reviews.Author: TheCanuckFoodie
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with good staff. All I can say. One of those "I am a modern, non shalant hotel, could be a Holiday Inn easily" But hey, it's clean, comfortable, a good breakfast, and are you going to be spending that much time in your room anyways, maybe only for pizza after a day spent in cafes, and I am sure there is no care in the world over decor at that time of the night! Just don't be surpised if you can't find your way to the right hotel... there are 100's of Nh's in Amsterdam... and don't be surprised by my high star rating on sleep quality... of course I am going to sleep well in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: gfayez
Reviews.Content: It really feels like home away from home. The location of the hotel is amazing, you can walk out of the hotel and you are in the heart of Amsterdam. The hotel staff are very friendly, the rooms are very warm and always clean. I always stay at NH Barbizon Palace whenver I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Mouse”
Reviews.Author: SARTOA
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel between the 3rd and 6th of November 2011, i found the hotel to be pretty good in General and the room ok but never a 5 star however i was not impressed when i saw a mouse quite happily eating from a used food tray that had been left outside a room next to mine ,the tray with food had been left outside a room all day and was only cleared once i informed the staff about the mouse , i must admit from then on i thought it wise not to eat in the Hotel again . I must admit i was disappointed with the staff members reaction to being informed about the mouse so i can only guess they are fully aware of the problem .

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: shugakookie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right accross the central station! It worked perfectly for us since we took the train from Schipoll airport. As soon as we got to the central station, we just crossed the street! The lobby was nice and updated and had free internet. The rooms are kinda old but I am not complaining. Our room was right on the canal so you could see boats upclose. It could get loud at times especially when party boats are around. When it comes to food, if you are on a budget, this hotel is perfect. There are a lot of small, cheap places which are literally just steps away from the hotel. This hotel is also steps away from the red light district and the coffee shops! It is just right on the next alley. Seriously! Also, if you want to see the rest of the city, biking is a good way of doing it. We biked from our hotel to all the museums! All in all it was a great experience. This hotel is marked as 5 star in Priceline (I got it for $100/night!), but for U.S. standards, I would say this is a 3-3.5. I LOVE Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: sahid a
Reviews.Content: lobby looks nice and the staff are very freindly but the rooms are so outdated looks like 1980s gramdmas house. the business centre is a digrace size of a toilet with one pc desktop in it made me laugh. the rooms arent definitly five star its got crt tv in it with a few poxy channels movies cost 14.50 euros a day. wifi is available only in the lobby not in the bedroom for 30 minutes a go than u have to re-login using this slip not worth the money we paid. free tea coffee was nasty as well boxed cheap sachets proppa tea/foffee set u back fiver lunch not included cost 20quid a day

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great service, If u are going to have fun.. Go for it!!”
Reviews.Author: mchechter
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by a last minute unpublished deal. Its a charming hotel close to the train stations and the "green light district". The room is really confortable. If u are going to Amsterdam to experience it all go for it! Its perfect for young couples.... But if you are older, boring, and want a 5* hotel... Its not a place for u!

Reviews.Title: “ONE OF MY FAVORITE AMSTERDAM HOTELS”
Reviews.Author: ColesDad1
Reviews.Content: This 5 star hotel is a short walk from the central station.If you don't have tons of luggage take the train from the airport and walk to the hotel.You'll save 50 euro for a taxi.Don't take the shuttle bus .last time i did wasted 2 hours of vacation time on a bus.This hotel is super nice.Good bar.Never ate there.Too many nice dining options off the waag.Shopping not to far away and right in the mix of the red light area and bars.Not as crazy as some make it out to be.What did you come to A-Dam for?Nice well taken care of rooms.I had a view of the cental station.Staff always great!I hate to hear people say only a 4 or 3 star hotel.You're in europe,you're lucky to get a elevator,in room restroom in a 3 star hotel.this is a 5 star european hotels and I love to say here.Hope to see the palace soon.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at the Barbizon”
Reviews.Author: rosie0000
Reviews.Content: Lovely upmarket hotel, central to everything. After booking another hotel and finding out there were 2 with the same name and the one I had picked was not a good one, I decided as it was our 1st Wedding Anniversary to spend a little more to ensure a good stay. On arrival, was very impressed with the monochrome foyer and the grand piano, just wish I could have plucked up the courage to play it (it did say you could). Staff excellent and very helpful, allowed us to check in 3 plus hours early and free tea and coffee was on offer in the foyer while we waited for our room to become available. As we were leaving on Sunday they offer you a late check out of 5pm free of charge (think it was called something like easy Sunday?). This was a great bonus with a late afternoon flight, so meant we could enjoy the whole day and not be turfed out at about 11am as other hotels do. Our room was lovely and big with the nice touches a hotel of this quality should bring, dressing gown, slippers, toiletries and tea and coffee making facilities. Also there was an iron, ironing board and hairdryer. T.V. with quite a few english speaking channels. We did not eat here, so cannot comment on this, but I really have no complaints at all, it really made our stay in Amsterdam very enjoyable. The location was really fantastic, we walked everywhere, no need even for a tram, very near to the train station. Getting a train from the airport was so easy and cost around 4 euros each way. So much to see and do in Amsterdam, we could not possibly do in 3 days, but Anne Frank's house was a must see, very surreal and kind of haunting. Loads of places to eat and drink and we had fabulous weather so sat outside most of the time. Food and drink expensive, around 30 euros for lunch for 2, however there is burger king/macdonalds etc for cheap bites to eat. For a pint of heineken was 5.50 euros, which I thought was expensive. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone, they made our Anniversary truly special, I am not sure we would have said the same if we had stayed in the first hotel I had booked, just so glad I changed the booking to the Barbizon Palace. Amsterdam is a great place, but not for a cheap break in my opinion, but I loved it and enjoyed every moment.

Reviews.Title: “Across the rd from central station”
Reviews.Author: Yorkieyams
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here about 12 months ago. Would of joined sooner but wasn't aware of the site. When i made the online booking i asked for a large smoking room with a great view as my partner hasn't been b4. This was taken care of no problem and we had a room facing central station which was great. I didn't think the room was of 5 star standard but i was very happy with it none the less. Breakfast was great. Lots of selection and was constantly topped up. Room was clean but instead of a double bed we had 2 single beds pushed together with double bedding on, but thats the norm in amsterdam. The hotel is on the edge of the red light district so maybe not for everyone but perfect for us. The only reason i wouldn't stay there again is only because i like to stay somewhere different every time.

Reviews.Title: “Location from central station can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: NaomiJonesT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly across from the train station so for us, having only 24 hours in Amsterdam was perfect. for the hotel, the service was excellent, the lobby area very nice. Rooms aren't bad, dated but not bad but the bed needs to be upgraded and the linens. Breakfast is very very good. Everything u would want is displayed and more for about 10 euros. Good deal. I'm sitting at breakfast now writing this review. Loved the soft boiled eggs. Need to learn how to do that. husband used the gym and enjoyed it. Has cardio and weights plus sauna and Turkish bath. Beware that the bath or steam room is co ed and clothing optional. Wish I had the nerve to do it. Opted for bath solo in my room. Tub was nice, lots of hot water. Good hotel to have all your basics covered and a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Needs Some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Hugh21
Reviews.Content: Spent a Saturday night here using an internet rate - very cheap for Central Amsterdam. Hotel was across the street from Amsterdam Centraal Station - and easy walk with luggage. It is on the northern edge of the red light district. Lobby was well appointed and clean. Unlimited free wifi in lobby (in 30 minute blocks) was nice - and this wifi feature is found at most NH hotels in Belgium and Holland. Now, the not-so-good: Building is old and rooms and carpeting need some updating. Musty and dirty hallway carpeting should be replaced. The rooms are substandard when compared to other NH hotels. Also, very noisy outside and in the hallways inside. I was on the 4th floor and although somewhat entertaining, the drunks outside yelling and breaking bottles at 3 AM did not make for a restful sleep. Hotel provides ear plugs in all guest rooms to combat the noise. This should be a warning. Hotel does have an exercise room as part of a "spa" but is costs extra to use and was not open in the evenings. Overall, Staff was friendly and professional, location (and price) was good. Not sure how this place is rated 5 stars - give it 3.5 at most.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, though far from a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: MIFFYTRAVELS
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for 3 people. The Hotel is one block from the Central Station and walking distance to most sites of interest. The room was spacious. However, when we checked-in on Saturday at noon the room wasn't ready. We had to leave our luggage in storage as the room wasn't assigned until several hours later. We were told they had been very busy the night before (!!!). We came back around 5pm, the room was ready, with 2 beds... We were told they would put in a 3rd bed. We left for the evening and came back at 1h30 am, only to find that the 3rd bed wasn't in the room yet...After several phone calls and almost rude answers, we finally got the bed and the extra towel. Given that we had reserved a room for 3, more than one month before our trip, it's unacceptable for a 5 star hotel. Even worse when there was no compensation for this inconvenience. At our check out the person at the desk was polite and apologetic, but nothing else....They could have made a little effort to compensate this annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Rubbiesarered
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Barbizon Palace. Rooms clean and comfortable, good selection of tv channels, albeit the tv was old and could do with replacing. As others have ementioned the rooms could do with some refurbishment and the restaurant prices are very expensive. Staff are very welcoming and helpful with directions and places to visit. Great location near the Central Station so all the attractions are within walking distance. Great late check out at 5pm on Sunday so you can snooze away Saturday night's excesses.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, staff & rooms in Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located directly opposite the Central Station of Amsterdam, in the middle of the center, so location cannot be beaten. Staff is always friendly, from reception to breakfast staff.... Unlike the other 5* NH Hotel Krasnapolsky, this hotel is not pretentious at all. Rooms are in old typical Amsterdam buildings, with 2 floor suites with good views.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Service, good location, but not a 5 Start hotel”
Reviews.Author: EarthWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Don't know how this place got a 5 star rating but I would say its a 2 or 3 star hotel. The staff is helpful and responsive but the hotel is dated, the gym equipment is old and dated as well, it just doesn't warrant a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Consistant”
Reviews.Author: fearmÃ³r
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Barbizon a few times now, I really think itâ€™s one of the best in Amsterdam. Itâ€™s very near the Tourist action spots, while its proximity to Central Station is great for business, which is why I stay there. There are 2 restaurants one with a star, that has a vegetable menu to die for. The one tip I offer, is to be careful of which room you get, based on your taste, as this hotel has the clean modern rooms as well as the rustic rooms with wooden beams etc. Different strokes for different folks !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, more than friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: RonaldW v
Reviews.Content: Great location, near central station, walking distance highlights of Amsterdam. Very helpfull concierge and staff. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but beware of the wrong rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AGall0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really excellent with great convention features and ideally placed in the center of Amsterdam, just five minutes walk from the railway station and close to the pedestrian area, facing the canals. I was placed in a very nice and big room on the inner street, the back side compared to the railway station and I felt lucky being far from the trains. When night came and time to go to sleep I realized it was the worst room ever... I was on the first floor and my window was facing the pedestrian area where all people where walking, chatting and even a band playing live in the pub just down the street. Not enough? the street lamps where just next to my window and even after closing the curtains my room was fully lit. I called immediately the front desk and complained but I was told there were no available rooms as everybody had already asked to change before me. A short live visit at the reception and I got a new room and I moved all my stuff myself to be sure nobody was going to pick my new room! they did not want to give me that room because it was facing the internal courtyard and there was no nice view outside. That was perfect!!!! I could not ask for a quieter room! But then another problem... there was some issue with water pressure, in the sense that while I was having my shower suddenly the cold water would stop and only hot boiling water would come out of the pipes burning my skin... maybe my neighbor next room had flushed his/her toilet? Anyway, the room was large, clean and comfortable and i enjoyed my stay at NH Barbizon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: atlantalisa_runs
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The rooms are what you'd expect for European rooms/bathrooms. The staff was very helpful, the location was great - w/in walking distance to everything, easy access from the transit from the airport...the housekeeping didn't care for my jet-lag/late morning 'sleep-ins' too much but aside from that, all was quite comfortable and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: louyo
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very friendly but customer service could be a little better. The breakfast we booked at 4pm on the Sat for the following Sun morning somehow got logged as that morning! The cheerful guy on restaurant duty phoned across to reception and said "sorry you were booked for Sat, nothing I can do" leaving us to walk over to reception and sort it out ourselves. Once we had - breakfast was excellent. We asked for a quiet room and were pleased with the one offered. Clean - apart from the net curtains. which were dirty. The hotel is well placed for public transport - a few mins stroll from main railway station, buses, trams and canal boats.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: Katyandmaik1
Reviews.Content: The check in was very good. the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. We had our room om the 3th floor inside and we did not like the room. we went back to the reception and the receptionist had showed as some other rooms. He was friendly and did not rush us to let us choose. after we decide he asked me the next day of everything was fine with the room great service! in the evening we went out for dinner an the concierge was so helpful he called several restaurants and get us an nice and decent italian restaurant! the rooms are not that great as the service they given. The rooms are old with very big televisons from the last century. there was even a lot of dust under the beds and the floor was old dirty carpet. It is more a 4 star hotel for service it is excellent if you go out of the room it is worth staying here

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline P
Reviews.Content: We went to the Barbizon Palace on 29th August 2011 to 2nd September 2011 and found it to be brilliant. After reading some of the other reviews I was not looking forward to it and had begun to wonder if we had done the right thing in booking this hotel, but on arrival we were welcomed by the receptionist, who was really helpful. We went with family and the hotel rooms we had booked, which were just standard rooms, were enormous and well equipped. The rooms were cleaned every day, we had fresh towels every day and they topped up the shower gel, shampoo, body lotion, soap etc every day as well. The breakfasts were marvellous. The lobby, breakfast room and bar are lovely areas. All the staff in the hotel were really friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to Central Station so it was not to far to walk to once we got off the train. It is ideally situated for visting places. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam - we thoroughly enjoyed it and would certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCD1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days for a long weekend with my daughters. Best location facing Central Station - easy to catch trams to go everywhere. Clean and comfortable with very friendly staff either to book restaurants or give vouchers to use the internet. Many choices for breakfast with delicious waffles. Maintains high NH standards and is a lively place to be. The only improvement would be the possibility to rent bikes for periods shorter than one day ( half a day ?). Will recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel to celebrate or wedding anniversary & birthday!!”
Reviews.Author: Fetishfemme
Reviews.Content: We have been to Amsterdam for many years now, but this is the first time we have stay at a 5 Star hotel and it was worth every penny! From the welcoming staff on reception to the staff taking our luggage up to our room and the nice quiet and beautifully clean large room and bed ... we were very happy. We came for a relaxing 5 day break to meet up with friends in and out of the city and they made it possible for us to enjoy our stay. There was nothing negative to report only positive feedback and a promise to return and say there again next year. Well done and many thanks to all the staff. 'Ronni & Mel Bryan

Reviews.Title: “Across from Central Station - enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Rhodesian57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbizon Palace Hotel in September 2011 and enjoyed it. The hotel is situated opposite Central Station making it very easy to travel to from the airport and easy to get cheap trams to wherever in the city, although you could also walk. Bring comfortable shoes for the cobbled streets and mind the bikes - they're everywhere! Our room was on the 1st floor and was on two levels - the bathroom was on your left when you entered the room and the bedroom was on a upper level, reached by stairs. Our room had a view of the road and we were worried that it would be too noisy in the evening, especially on a Friday. Reception said that would swap us into an internal room if desired. We decided to wait and see. In the end there was some noise, but we were so tired after all the walking we slept like the dead. Very nice people in the Reception, by the way. Lovely complimentary orange juice there too. We liked the complimentary tea/coffee available for you in the room with a kettle. On pair of slippers and an ironing board are also supplied. No bathrobes. There is an in-room safe and nice touches such as a book "bedtime stories" which has various stories written by well known authors. Also complimentary toiletries are left for you in the bathroom - shower gel, soaps, moisturiser, tissues, toothbrush. We checked on Tripadvisor re breakfast and decided not to eat in the hotel on the first morning - big mistake. Only a few shops were open at 10 o'c when we went out looking and we ended up having waffles and scones for breakfast. Next day we stayed in the hotel. It's well worth paying the â‚¬19 each for a very delicious breakfast. You won't need lunch after it. You can also leave you luggage when checking out and come back on your way to Central Station - very handy. All in all, a good hotel in a great location and one which I would certainly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure to stop here !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tillyp15
Reviews.Content: We..... thats two couples spent four nights end of August at the Barbizon Palace and we found it a pleasure to stop there. A Hotel with a most impressive lobby. The location was ideal for trains, trams, buses or just to walk through the city. The rooms standard doubles were of a good size and well appointed to the needs of a tourist clean, tidy, drinks fridge,tea & coffee making facilities, tv and telephone. The beds were very comfortable and we slept well. Although the rooms overlooked a street there was no problem with noise at night to any extreme. The breakfast was very good with plenty of choice of hot and cold food, juices,tea coffee milk etc. All the staff were polite helpfull and friendly to us and were always willing to help when approached. Top tip is to book breakfast on orignal booking with hotel or agent it seems better value than paying daily. We would also advise the use of the I Amsterdam tourist card it was very usefull throughout the City.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a palace”
Reviews.Author: VirtualOli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference with work in mid August. I was impressed by the proximity to Centraal Station, and also by the modern bright reception and restaurant area. The lifts and the rooms however were very old fashioned. The decor was over 10 years old, in the bathrooms too. No plasma tvs yet either. I changed rooms twice, the first one was opposite a very loud Irish bar that kept me awake until 1am (ask for a quiet room if you want a good night's sleep!) and the second didn't have any hot water. They quickly brought me a key to go and use another room's shower, and later that day they looked at the water in my old room. When i say 'looked at' I mean that they put the temperature up so far that there wasn't actually any cold water. It was hot at its lowest setting! Did they not test this and put themselves in my shoes?! The staff were very attentive and friendly, no complaints there, and the food was good too. The lunch menu was very boring and standard 'international' (tasteless club sandwich, burgers and chips) but there is so much in the vacinity that you'd be mad to eat dinner in the hotel itself. I was very disappointed that you had to pay extra to use the spa facilities, and that there was no pool. I wouldn't stay here again if i was in Amsterdam. There's much more choice with much more individuality and modernity, not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, in the wrong place”
Reviews.Author: jerushlm
Reviews.Content: After unexpectedly landing at barbizon (See my review on Krasnapolsky) we were pleased to be in a very well managed and quiet hotel. Excellent breakfast buffet, every request fullfilled on the spot, A very positive experience

Reviews.Title: “lovely, well located hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: khill02
Reviews.Content: \we stayed at the barbizon recently and enjoyed a very pleasant stay at this well located hotel.We paid extra for hotel parking but although this was expensive( you need to pre book this) it was very convienient. Breakfast was buffet style There was a good choice and it wasgood quality.We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Brit99
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not live up to its claims for being a 5-star hotel. I have stayed here twice and on both occasions have been sorely disappointed. Rooms: Both rooms were small and tired, with one being in the basement and almost below canal level - it was a bit of a suprise when i opened my curtains to find the canal at chest level and boat loads of tourists on canal cruises looking in at me! The TV's are old and do not come with a good selection of channels, but the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are fine. The service also does not live up to 5-star levels, food is ok but not great and staff are a little impersonal

Reviews.Title: “TICKS ALL THE BOXES!”
Reviews.Author: thomascee
Reviews.Content: We hadn't booked to stay here for our 3 day trip to amsterdam. It was our life saver aftre the nightmare of booking into the god awful France Hotel around the corner. See my negative comments on that dump of a hotel.Anyway after walking out of that nightmare and refusing to accept the dingy, dark room, smelly room there we had to find somewher else to stay fairly quick on a wet thrusday night and this was the first hotel we tried. It was a life saver and restored our trust in there being good quality hotels that ofer value for money. We negoiated a good price for a 3 night stay, only 50 euros more than the grotty France Hotel but a world of difference in quality comfort and style. Lovely room, clean, modern and spacious, friendly courteous staff, a quality good value hotel in a convenient location. We would definately stay here again or in one of their sister hotels spread around the city. No hesitation in recommneding this to visitors to this great city. It could be noisy a night, but this is Amsterdam and the party goes on into the early hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: travelling_gunner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends. The hotel is located close to the central station of Amsterdam, close to Dam Square (main square in the city) and close to the redlight district. The lobby and all design of the hotel is very nice. Parking is kinda expensive but thats everywhere in Amsterdam. Rooms and most public areas are very spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LRF77
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the city is pretty accessible from this location whether by foot (Anne Frank house is a 20min walk) or by trams at the central station. The hotel is definitely not a five star one and is in dire need of refurbishing. Yet, the staff were helpful and practical (you get what you need!). The food at the coffee shop is really good and they have quite a good variety on offer. There is also a very nice coffee shop with fantastic service) just around the corner of the hotel ( with a white facade) in case you are not on BB basis.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Chiefen72
Reviews.Content: Great location! Room standards are ok. Most of the staff are not up to standard! The check in nor the doorman and absolutely not the personel in the gym! I didnt feel welcome at all to this hotel. And will never return. Not worth the money. It is a shame on her great location and historical building! Could eb something if they put some efforts but sorry, not for me yet!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: david_halloran
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of July 2011. The Hotel is in a pretty good location. It is right by the train station and around some interesting places to see in Amsterdam. It is off to one side of the city though not in the center so if you want to see things on the other side of town you need to ride a bike or take the tram or something, its a pretty far walk. The hotel itself had a very nice lobby area but our room was rather subpar. The room felt like it was last remodeled at the beginning of the 90's or something. It seemed odd having such a modern lobby and such outdated rooms. That is my only real complaint with this hotel. The rooms are definitely not the rooms of a four star hotel and maybe not even a three star hotel. It is very overrpriced for the room that you are given. Other than that though everyone at the hotel was very helpful and courteous and our stay went very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Guru-Kat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Barbizon Palace a few times because the location is so good and they are one of only a few hotels in Amsterdam were you can get a smoking room. The bedrooms let the hotel down as they are quite tired looking, dated and really need a refurb. Breakfast is good if you have it included in your room rate but I don't think its worth paying 25 euros for. The reception and bar area are nice and we found all the staff very helpful. We would go back because of the location but the Amrath is our favourite even though its a little further out (5 mins walk from Barbizon)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and big room”
Reviews.Author: Siuju
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel because the air-condition was broken in the room we stayed in NH amsterdam centre. Good location as it's close to the central station. It's easy for one to get to airport from central station. Even though it's not as luxury as other 5 star hotel as it's a bit dated. It's built on a building that was 17th or 18th century. It's still very clean. The bathroom and room are big. They provide ear plug as there is construction nearby but we don't need to use it. One small complaint is the air-con again. We open it to the highest but it keep at a temperature of 24-25 for the whole night. I was told that we were unlucky that it was the hottest day in June(30 degrees).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed! Not a 5* room!”
Reviews.Author: SLandFL
Reviews.Content: We didn't arrive until 10pm Friday evening , dumped our overnight bags in the room and rushed off to meet our daughter who lives and works in the city (NOT the red-light district - I hasten to add!). The staff and main reception of the hotel are very nice - however, on closer inspection of our room (didn't get to bed until 1.30am) - we were very disappointed to find the bed was nothing but a 'pull out of the wall' type of arrangement.
