My husband had commented that it was very low - (even low for me and I'm only 4'11") - when I looked at the base it was a collection of metalwork like you'd find on a sofa-bed. To make matters worse, the headboard was a couple of broken pieces of board covered in crappy carpet - revealing the cables and piston things that controlled the lowering of the bed, It was also very small!!! "Never mind" we thought, it's only for one night (even though I'm thinking of how much we paid for this 5* room) ..........it turned out to be one very very very long night! A word of warning - DO NOT STAY IN ROOM 116 unless you are deaf! I suppose the provision of earplugs at the bedside table should have warned us of things to come! ~ the position of the room is internal at the hotel and actually suspends over the reception and marble reception area. All night long we had to endure the 'clip clopping' of stiletto shoes back and forth, back and forth on the marble flooring below. My husband can sleep through a loud thunderstorm - but even he was awake most of the night! On check-out I did inform the receptionist about our displeasure- her reply was that we should have said something and they would have moved us - a nice enough gesture but we didn't really want to move rooms at 3.30am! What I fail to understand about this is that the Barbizon Palace is clearly a nice hotel in a fantastic location - it has a 5* rating and as far as I could make out it wasn't fully booked - yet they choose to place guests such as ourselves in what I presume is a below standard room with a very poor bed........it is such a disappointment when you have been looking forward to a stay away from home. Needless to say - we won't be going back to this hotel when we visit Amsterdam again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunmagic
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the NH Barbizon Palace for three nights in April 2011. The hotel was booked through an online Travel Agent at an excellent rate. There were no problems with the booking procedure, with the confirmation email received within 30 minutes of the booking being made. Our flight arrived in Amsterdam Schiphol airport in the early afternoon, and after picking up our luggage we headed downstairs to catch a train up to Centraal Station. There is a regular service, with the journey time around 20 minutes. We didnâ€™t have to wait more than 10-15 minutes before catching our train. The fare is reasonable too, with several ticket machines located throughout Schiphol Plaza. Once arriving at Centraal, the hotel is only 5 minutes walk across Prins Hendrikkade, easily manageable even with two cases (on wheels). First impressions of the exterior of the hotel were positive, as it has been converted from several 17th century houses. Once arriving inside to check in, you cannot fail to be impressed with the lobby. We were greeted by reception by name, with the whole process complete within 5 minutes. We headed up in the lift to our room on the first floor and were both impressed with the room. It was of a good size for a central Amsterdam hotel, and the room was clean and everything was in good, working order. Our room was located at the rear of the hotel, overlooking Oudezijds Kolk. Even though Zeedijk with numerous bars was only 20 or so metres from our window, we never really noticed too much noise â€“ although we were fully aware we were located in the heart of the city. With the central canal belt being quite compact, most of the major sites of the city were well within walking distance from the hotel. As mentioned earlier, the hotel is at the northern end of Zeedijk, so you come out of the front entrance of the hotel and there are plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from. Overall, we found the NH Barbizon Palace an excellent hotel as a base for exploring Amsterdam. All the staff were very friendly, and we are already looking to book our next stay in Amsterdam at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Quiet Room”
Reviews.Author: wadeonplanetearth
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was directly across from the main rail station in Amsterdam and this negated the need for a taxi on arrival or departure. The hotel was clearly built in another time and the hotel has been renovated a number of times but the room decor and renovations are not at 5star level. Before i arrived i knew it was only a 4 star property, the staff where friendly on check in and the concierge team where also very helpfull. This would be suitable for business people overnighting it as its very close to restaurants and bars in the canal / red light area. I found the room i was in was quiet and no noise from cars or people, the room was at the back of the property.

Reviews.Title: “The worst 5star hotel I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: AGolubev
Reviews.Content: Very ugly staff, bad rooms, perfect location, bad room service. I've booked a suite in this hotel and was really disappointed by the staff and the cleanlyness of the room. Please, never book this hotel if you want a 5star experience in Amsterdam. Great city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Allysia81
Reviews.Content: Genrally this is a nice hotel in fantasitc location. It is only a few minutes walk from Central Station in Amsterdam and simultainously it is located in the very city centre. The rooms are quite small but equipped with everything that is necessary. It is quite noisy as the windows are over the canal where boats are passing by but it does not affect the sleep. Very nice restaurant with good, various breakfast. People at the reception very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Staff - Not a 5 Star Property”
Reviews.Author: kerouackid
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the morning (8 am) and was promptly checked in. My room overlooked the canal. I was treated very well during my stay. The staff were professional, accommodating, and very friendly. I was very impressed with their attitude towards service. I noticed this from my interaction with the Bel Hops to my conversation with a Manager. I received excellent service all around. Now the not so good: The hotel is dated. It is in need of a remodel. Upholstery, furnishings and decor all have signs of age and wear. The floor I stayed on had a very musty odor. The odor was also evident in my room. If Hotel class were strictly rated on service, this would definitely be a 5 star facility. If you want the comfort level normally associated with a 5 star property, I would pass. I would stay again, but only after a remodel. Next time, I will return to IC Amstel.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Courtesy but old fashioned rooms too”
Reviews.Author: juejosh
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at the Barbizon Palace for 3 nights in early May 2011; Having booked this hotel via lastminute (we paid Â£334 for 3 nights room only) we contacted the hotel directly to ensure that the room we were allocated was suitable for wheelchair access (having read on here that some of the rooms have internal steps or are very small) and also to request an early check-in as we were arriving at Amsterdam at about 9am and would have been up since approx 3.30am. We were allocated room 262 - a large room with a standard bathroom plus an ajoining additional adapted bathroom. Room faced an internal courtyard, opposite the corridor, so curtains were generally kept closed when in the room. The bathroom was well stocked with the usual amenities plus a brush, sponge and razor/shaving cream and also toothbrush/paste - welcome extras to the standard shower gel/shampoo/body lotions, especially if taking only hand luggage. Room had kettle and tea/coffee in room, iron & ironing board, a nice modern tv (bbc1 & 2 for british guest, and plenty of other channels) pay per view movies a tad expensive at 17.50e, no wifi available in room - except at additional cost. There was wi fi in the lobby foc, and a computer terminal was available for guest use free of charge for 5 minutes only - need to get password from reception, however took 3 mins to log on so no time really to check emails or reply to them, without additional costs being incurred. Bar area is nice as is terrace area, again a little expensive but quality is good. Had a cup of tea in the lobby, which was accompanied by a plate of mini desserts, which was a nice touch and delicious too, cost a little more than at the cafe next door, but quality made it worth while, not to mention the service. Did not use hotel for breakfast, instead had a long lie in and got brunch at Teddys corner - just up the road on warmoestraat - our usually choice for breakfast, which only cost 8.50e pp as opposed to 25e each at the hotel, and no time restriction either, which suited us better on this trip. The hotel is ideally placed for centraal station, and also has a taxi rank right outside, and just to the left about 30 yards is the metro entrance. Bus and tram stops are also close, just near the station too. Most tourist attractions are easily reachable, and the RLD is just to the rear of the hotel, but it is also easy to avoid the area if you so wish. All in all it was a great stay - just disappointing that we could not get the early check-in that we soo needed, and had requested, but all the same, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the rooms need updating and over priced”
Reviews.Author: Ardsguymarty
Reviews.Content: No complaints with our overall stay, the room was fine but a little dated with features such as a radio beside the bed the size of a small suitcase. Clean room and the bathroom was fine too. I think the rooms are over priced and was annoyed having to fork out nearly Â£12 per day for wifi in the room, considering the hotels star rating. Good location and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “happy times at NH Barbizon”
Reviews.Author: mrssmiggs
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 very pleasant nights at this hotel. Its location is great and it is a clean and stylish hotel. The staff were excellent and made us feel very special. The bar prices are expensive and we did not eat in the restaurant, but it looked very good. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derekwozthere
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and pleasant however I expected more from a 4 star hotel. It is quite simple, and wifi, fitness centre etc are all excluded from the price. Not good value for money overall

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel at all.”
Reviews.Author: Pau109
Reviews.Content: I attended this hotel towards the end of March with several friends after a 15hr drive through France. We had intially intended to stay just the one night and anticipated arriving late morning, however as the traffic was good we arrived at 3am. We called the hotel enroute and were assured that there was plenty of room. What annoyed me a little was being charged a full nights accomodation despite what was effectively an early check in. Nevertheless, the hotel exceeded my expections in almost every department. My room (Room 7) was spacious and comfortable. It was on the ground floor and on two levels. It looked out onto the canal and neighbouring bars. This looked lovely during the day but was quite noisy at night. The room was clean with plenty of towels and a few complimentary lotions and potions. I would have expected more for a five star hotel though. There was plenty of storage space and the bed was very comfortable indeed. The only let down was the TV. For the size of room it was too small and the picture quality was poor. The selection of channels was also quite poor and none of the pay per view channels worked. Despite this, I was quite impressed with my room and found it much larger than other hotels offer in Amsterdam. The staff at the hotel are fairly good. All speak good English and all are willing to help out where appropriate. I ate lunch in the restaurant on the Sunday and found the food to be delicious and fair in price. The selection of food was quite poor though. On the whole I was very impressed with this hotel and would certainly visit again if the price is right. I have stayed in many Amsterdam hotels now and this one certainly one of the best. The strongest aspect of this hotel is its location. It is a 2min walk from Central Station and directly adjacent to the Red Light District. Despite its central location all the rooms were a good size and all seemed very comfortable indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but noisy and some rooms are not up to par”
Reviews.Author: tiduj
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms in the hotel; one was quite nice, overlooking the main street, clean, spacious and relatively quiet. The other one, however, was on the top floor and felt like an attic. Very high ceiling, open beams - would actually be kind of cool except it was dark, small, stuffy and really noisy (overlooking the bars in the red light district). I don't understand how the same hotel can offer both rooms - and for the same price. I'd only recommend the hotel if you can get one of the better rooms. The location's perfect, right across the train station. And as others remarked, no way is this hotel a five-star one. But since we weren't looking for luxury (and got a good deal, way below the advertised price) this didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Meadens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbizon Palace for 3 nights. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and my birthday, and we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to room 401 for our stay â€“ a truly amazing room. Our room and the whole hotel were very clean. Good quality toiletries in the room too. Reception and restaurant staff all very pleasant and added to our first experience of Amsterdam. Hotel is in an ideal location to visit all sights on foot - as we did! We would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone, and will definitely be returning. This was our first stay in a NH hoteland we were very impressed. We will be joining the NH World Programme as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed after reading previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: sugar1978
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I was sceptical of my visit. This hotel was easily to get to from airport as central station is just over the road. The hotel itself looks very impressive from the lobby area and staff were very helpful although definitely not a 5* hotel its very close to a 4*, rooms are very clean although there was an unexplained noise that kept us awake for some part of the night. Very impressed with location and would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Better than some reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: LinnyLou9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay and pleased to say that overall very pleasant hotel. Room spacious and clean, comfortable bed and pillows, bathroom ok. Noise level fine considering our room at front of hotel. Agree with previous review re. not so nice odour on entering lobby, some fresh flowers would be a nice touch and maybe freshen the whole reception. Staff efficient and non-intrusive, not over smiley but ok. Breakfast, excellent choice on buffet, even a glass of bubbly if you fancy it! Location great, would certainly choose to stay here again if re-visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: LudvikG
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend at the Barbizon Palace, found a good deal on the Net (normal prices are in the high end). Fantastic location for shopping and exploring the city with the trams so close by. Room was larger than we expected, clean and quiet. Breakfast was excellent and we found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and cheerful. Will certainly stay here again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, adequate rooms & serivce but does not feel like 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: HappiestTraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barbizon is perfectly adequate for work travel. Good conference facilities for large groups (our group was approx. 160 people and they coped well with that), but the rooms are a bit old and in need of refurbishing for my taste. The lobby is very modern and the retaurant is quite lovely. The conference rooms vary from small and dingy to spectacular - in fact the most spectacular I've seen: in the chapel of an old church (pre-hotel time) with the steeples still in tact. Fantastically high ceilings and great amounts of natural light. An truly excellent conference venue but for guests who need to stay on site it's a little let down by older rooms. Staff are friendly and helpful and location is brilliant (central and across from Central Station).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel Certainly no 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: erikleeindianaUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights March 2011. Room was decent size. Hotel location is great if using the Centraal train station to the airport. Easy walk to sights also. VERY close to Red Light District but felt safe around hotel. 2 downsides . Firstly, Hotel had a musty if not downright rank odor when you walked into lobby. Room didnt have odor however. Avoid the breakfast buffet if not included in your room cost. 25 EUROs per person!!! Just outside hotel to left is an English decor looking restaurant with a 9.25 EURO buffet. Same food, big savings!!! Overall, not bad but not outstanding!!

Reviews.Title: “5-star hotel... from the 90s. Definitely not value-for-money!”
Reviews.Author: chrisnky
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via lastminute.com as a secret hotel, and only found out later of the identity. If I had known, I probably wouldn't have reserved it going by the reviews and pictures here on Tripadvisor. My experience is similar to other travellers - average, and probably wouldn't stay here again despite the location, which was nice (almost directly opposite the Central Station). Check-in was fine; receptionist couldn't be considered warm, but efficient and competent enough. I asked for a quiet room after reading some reviews about noise, and got one of the rooms on the 4th floor facing the inside of the building. Free internet was present at only the lobby. For internet in rooms, 24-hours costs â‚¬10.70. Corridors was long but that can't be helped as that was the layout of the hotel. However, they could change the carpets and lighting so it wouldn't look so dated and tired. Upon entering the room, it was spacious and clean looking. Room wasn't so energy efficient, despite the hotel mentioning it had some environmental green policy, as the electricity in the room was not controlled by the key card as most modern hotels are. Lights remained on as long as you didn't turn it off. Furniture was very dated, and not even a flat screen TV. The furniture quality was neither of high standards. The cupboard had creaky squeaking doors and you had to open the adjacent sliding door before you could open the first one as they don't slide over each other. Very frustrating. Carpet also looked very old and dirty; I didn't want to walk barefooted on it. Bed was a little on the soft side, and wasn't a particularly thick mattress either. There was a small piece of paper on each pillow wishing you 'good night'; quite redundant. The room temperature was on the high side, which was fine for winter but could imagine unbearable during summer. Despite turning the temperature right down to the lowest, it wasn't particularly cooling, while the air vent became louder. Toilet was spacious and clean; toiletries were fine. I forgot my toothpaste and appreciated that there was some provided. No complaints about the toilet whatsoever. My biggest irritation was no doubt the ironing board, as I was traveling for business and had to iron my shirts. The board was lopsided and very difficult to iron on. The padding on the board had also came off. I certainly did not expect to find this in a 5-star hotel! All in all, I think this is a fine hotel to stay in if it had been a 3 or 4 star hotel with lower prices. But given the 5-star label and the price, this was indeed a below average experience I had, given the fact I have stayed in many 5-star hotels and this was by far the worst. I think the hotel should seriously consider re-investing some of its profits to upgrading the hotel. You will definitely be able to find better alternatives to the Barbizon "Palace" in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars? More like two.”
Reviews.Author: Rikta
Reviews.Content: I am not a complaining type of person. I never asked to change the hotel room before. It was getting late. After finding my room through a labyrinth of corridors and arrows "rooms x to x+4 left, x+5 to x+9 right", walking through what appears to be connections between adjacent buildings, I was looking forward to get some rest. The magnetic card lock gave up after some 6 attempts, and I was in. From the entrance, some 6 stairs covered by an old carpet lead up to the main room, with a bed, desk and trusty 20'' TV. No ventilation on. OK bathroom. I climbed the stairs and sensed the strange odor of my "non-smoking" room. OK, I thought, I can manage this. Memories of my student days passed through my head. I connected my Mac to the power, realizing it stuck well to the desk. No surprise, as the desk was covered by liquid stains. It was getting late and I was hungry, so I thought I would order some room service bite. The menu was deformed, from long use and what appears to be a beer spill. OK, I found some dishes that were served also 10 PM. Thirsty, I opened the minibar to grab a beer. It was really creepy to find out the previous guest was putting empty cans back in the fridge, to avoid paying for them. I realized the window could be opened, and grasped for air. Too bad, some 300 cigarette butts were decaying in Amsterdam drizzle just off the window sill ... That's where the odor came from. After complaining, the staff moved me to another room, which was fine. However, you never recover from the first impression, which this review i about. PS. Do not eat the breakfast in the hotel, unless included in your fare. It is OK, but absolutely not worth the 25 Euro price tag. There are dozens of eateries within easy walk from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovelifeholiday
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying here. We booked 3 nights for the price of 2, really great deal. The hotel markets itself as 5* but actually is a 4*. Room was of standard size but the aircon didnt work properly. It came on but didn't actually achieve anything, would hate to think what its like in the summer, the bathrooms are fairly dated but cleanliness of hotel was great. The beds are also really comfy with the choice of a 'pillow menu'. Lobby has great comfy couches and breakfast was included with a vast choice of cooked food and pastrys. Upstairs, the corridors are really old fashioned and you feel like you are walking forever just to get to your room. No joke, it's like a scene out of the shining, never ending corridors and a bit eerie. Staff are really friendly and helpful although they gave us a double room instead of a twin, they changed it straight away. Good hotel to stay for a couple of days, location is perfect for central amsterdam and directly opposite the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: beattyjim1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a romantic break, location was excellent as its 2 mins from central station, didn't use a taxi once. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful even lending umbrellas on rainy days! Its only a couple of mins walk to Dam square and some wonderful restaurants in chinatown. The Ann Frank house is a must! Would definitely consider staying there again. Jim in Wexford.

Reviews.Title: “worse hotle ever”
Reviews.Author: CATZ01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i did'nt get the room we booked and the room we got was nothing like the photos,it was dark,small,no viwe and had a bad smell..then they took 250euro of my card and then 220euro the n.day,when i booked it, i was told it was going to be 175 they added treavl tax on which was 40euro and now im still waiting for so called deposit of 250 euro that they did'nt even ask or tell me about when we were there..DON'T STAY HERE ITS A RIP OFF

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: Fayemous
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel to stay in, we stayed for 4 nights and had no problems, staff were friendly, breakfast was ok, room was very clean and tidy and the location was very central. Only 2 minutes walk from train station, easy to find. Luckly breakfast was included when we booked the hotel, otherwise its 25 euros pp, not worth that much. Overall I would stay there again and I would rate this hotel to a friend

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite 5 star hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sraske
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great from the lobby, but the other common areas and rooms are a bit worn. Overpriced for what you get. Service was good. Location excellent for walking around Amsterdam and close to train station. I would not spend my own money here, good on an expense account I suppose. Parking is 4.70 Euro an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the fifth star?”
Reviews.Author: GolferPar5
Reviews.Content: From my entire experience at the hotel, I can only ask... Where is the fifth star? This hotel is marketed as a 5 star, but I would rate it as a 4 star. A 4 star with decent service and a dated building, yes. But a 4 star none the less. Rooms are ok in size. Staff are fairly friendly and attentive. Rooms and the whole building in general is dated and needs some refurbishment. Location is fantastic. Beds too soft for my taste, but I guess i just like a hard bed ;) Price was surprisingly reasonable for a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dyrmos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights this month. The Hotel is in an very good position when reaching by train, only a short walk from Central Station.Also, large for the enticements in the centre area. Be alerted there is foremost building work round the station.The hotel greeting staff are very good, when we reached I inquired for a calm position, and whereas the hotel was very strongly registered they expended one time looking at whatThey couldDo for us. They finally upgraded us to a deluxe room at no additional charge.The rooms are what you would anticipate in an 4/5 Star Hotel, with all the common facilities. Very comfortble beds. Although I believe calling it a 5 Star hotel is being a bit generous.Our large-scale difficulty was the disturbance in the road underneath our room, which was established on the 4th floor at the back of hotel. The road had a large allowance of bars and associations and the yelling and vocalising went on until 3.00 inThe morning. And contemplating we inquired for a calm room it was unbelievable. Also the room was very strongly twice glazed, and that didn't desensitize the noise!! Being beside the red lightweight locality it conspicuously captivated numerous friends on stag nights/weekends.I can't obvious error the Hotel, only the position which is very noisy.Probably when the hotel was constructed there was notThe difficulty of drunken juvenile persons, but regrettably it is now widespread in town centres.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Bowtell
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a treat for my husbands birthday. Just a one night stay in Amsterdam. i wanted to make it special so booked an NH hotel rather than the hostels we have often stayed in before. The location is superb. Right near the station and the RLD. On arriving, the man behind the desk was very accomodating and treated us as valued customers (despite the fact i have blue hair). Excellent. The room was decorated like your Granny's comfy bedroom. A Bit old fashioned but very comfortable and the mattress was of excellent quality. The bathroom was very clean with lots of travel sized treats to use/steal. We saw the robes and slippers but didn't bother with them. The temprature control was easy and efficent. It's a shame that the mini-bar doesn't let you put your own bits in. It was also a shame that our view was of a wall. We didn't bother with the internet or breakfast (lovely wafflehouse nearby) so I cannot comment on them. On checking out, the same man was at the desk. He was again very polite and helpful. However, we were asked to pay a 6 Euro city tax. I later had to reclaim that via the website I booked through that had claimed all taxes were included with my price so be aware of that. All in all, I really enjoyed my stay but I do think it is a little over-priced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing location, great rooms with lesser quality of service”
Reviews.Author: Jonycold
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, just opposite Amsterdam Centraal train station, no more then 3 minutes walk, and if your lucky, your room would have a lovely view of the station (mine didn't) service at the reception was lukewarm. the lobby is gorgeous. the room is clean, spacious, nice, however old and in need for an urgent refurbished. this is one of the only hotels in amsterdam still offering smoking rooms - but they only have 5 or 6 of them. the rate was very expensive, however for a one night 's stay this would be fine. i will deferentially come here again

Reviews.Title: “How does this star rating work again?”
Reviews.Author: DVG59
Reviews.Content: This is one of these hotels making me wonder again how a hotel gets its stars. If this is a 5 star, there should be a lot of 6 and 7 stars hotels in the world. Maybe the star rating was based on the room price? It is not a bad hotel, just plain average. I would give it 3 stars, and that is because the location is fantastic. It needs a serious refurbishing except for the ground floor. Elevators are small, slow, and the key card system doesn't always work. Annoying. Rooms are of reasonable size, but worn out. Bathroom was outdated, and in few places there was black mildow around the bath/shower! Nothing completely repulsive, but still... Restaurant was full one moring. There is a chique sign saying "wait here to be seated", which only meant that you have to register your room number so they can bill you. You will not be seated. No help on finding a free table either. Not even the intention of quickly clearing some dirty tables, untill I requested this. 5 stars??? (Business-) lunches in the hotel restaurant were good. Simple, fast and tasty. Excellent. Wifi is a joke, a bad one. For the price of the rooms I would have expected at least an internet connection in the room. Wifi or cable. non of this. You can buy 24h WiFi access at nearly 18 euro per day! What a ripp off. Guests get a 30 minute connection for free in the lobby, but that connection was so slow I disconnected and switched to 3G. Disgraceful. Very bad. The "Business center" is a telephone boot sized room with a pc and a printer.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star? - What a joke”
Reviews.Author: Isee708
Reviews.Content: Bland reception/lounge area; room corridors that resemble student dorms; room with scuff and dirt marks on the wallpaper; very dated fittings and furnishings. I could go on. For the price, and I did get a last minute deal this is a terrible hotel. I've stayed in NH hotel properties in Spain and their 3 star offerings are better than this property. Only benefit is the 2 minute walk from the Centraal Station. That's it. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Third time in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: WE11RN
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time in Amsterdam. The Barbizon is a great stay. Clean, located across fron central station, and close to shopping and sightseeing. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bed was super comfy. The room and bath were large and modern. When we return to the Dam we will stay at the Barbizon Place again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Imazoid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights and pretty impressed. It is conveniently located across from Centraal station so it's not too far to drag your suitcase once you're off the train. No need to catch a taxi. Centraal station is also the hub for Amsterdam's excellent public transport system, so if you plan to use a bus or a tram it's just a matter of walking across to the station and finding the right stop. Of course the main reason you're reading this is to learn about the hotel and the rooms it contains. The lobby is very smart, and the check in process was very efficient. The elevators require you to use your room key to activate them and this was explained at check in. The room we got was large and very clean. As other reviews have stated the furniture looks a bit dated - and yes that includes the TV's - but everything worked. We had a room overlooking the road at the front of the hotel and yet we didn't find it particularly noisy. As we had booked just a room, everything else required an additional fee. Internet access is not free although I believe you could get a coupon to get 15 minutes free access from the check in desk. Amsterdam is full of places that have free wireless Internet access so we didn't use this option. Want to keep fit? Yep use of the Gym costs extra too. I can imagine if you did pay for all of the extra amenities the cost would rise very quickly indeed. As for getting something to eat. The surrounding area is full of Restaurants and bars so we didn't eat at the hotel. The Breakfast buffet can cost up to 25 Euros each (Continental breakfast is a little less) but looked to be of a very high quality. Like some previous reviewers we did breakfast at the buffet place next door to a neighboring hotel which was adequate. Overall I would stay at this hotel again. Would I pay the nightly rate the hotel advertises on their website...probably not, but if you get this through the Priceline "Name your own price" option as we did, I believe you'll be very happy with what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip To Old Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dbverycherry
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal with flights and stayinmg in this upper class hotel 5 **** on Expeidia. The room was rather small and tucked right away and at the back of the hotel. Still the room and bed was comfy and clean. We had a choice of types of pillows and had plenty of new toiletries and teas and coffees sachets left out for us each day to make use of. On our return each day fresh towels had been left, our room tidied and made spotless . An ideal hotel to use as a base but not one to eat unless money is no problem. Given the expense of eating in and also having so many places to eat out in locally we didn't even opt for having breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “So-so hotel in a location that's good but has its downside”
Reviews.Author: msandman
Reviews.Content: The NH Barbizon tries to be a 5-star hotel but itâ€™s really 4 stars, and given the slightly shabby state of the rooms and hallways itâ€™s a stretch to get to that. Itâ€™s convenient to the train station, and itâ€™s on the on the edge of the old â€œred light district.â€� The district has been cleaned up recently and itâ€™s now lined with bars, restaurants and porn shops. The area is not unsafe at all and itâ€™s not off-putting, but you hear quite a lot of street noise in the rooms that look out on Zeedijk. The hotelâ€™s public spaces are nice. Thereâ€™s a conference center in an adjacent building that was once a church, and the main meeting room has soaring ceilings and a balcony. The furnishings in the rooms are OK, nothing special, and everything looks a bit worn and tired, but the room I had was large and the bed was comfortable. The wood frame window opened but didn't close well enough to block street noise. The staff is friendly and competent. As is typical in Amsterdam hotels, as long as you donâ€™t need anything extra youâ€™ll feel well treated. The hotel restaurant has a very complete buffet at breakfast and lunch. Itâ€™s a so-so hotel in a so-so location, but itâ€™s OK for both business and tourists. If you want to stay in this area, consider the Victoria, equally close to the central train station but on the other side of the Damrak inlet. Itâ€™s in better condition and a bit closer to the main shopping and sightseeing places.

Reviews.Title: “The springs from the mattress left indentations on my rib cage.”
Reviews.Author: BarrioTravelers
Reviews.Content: This was a Priceline "find." We got it for a little more than $100 a night. Told it was a 5 star facility, please!!! It's barely a 2 star property. Before I knock it a bit, I must say this hotel has potential. It's in a great spot, close to train station and near a lot of the action. It does offer 15 minutes of free Internet once per night per room. But the bottom line is this, it's an awful hotel if you're expecting a 5 star type place. There was dust and dirt in all the closet space and shelves. The carpets are worn and dirty. There was mold in the bathroom ceiling. It's obvious they just paint over it, but it's hard to cover that up. The bed was awful. You could feel the springs as you rolled over. It was the Bates Motel. Of course they were "sold out" and didn't have any other rooms. The television was "snowy" with really bad reception. If you can avoid it, do it. This was the final straw for us with Priceline. How does it get away with this? I guess it's true what they say, you get what you pay for. And with the NH Barbizon Palace, you get a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: snootchiebootchies
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed one night here in September and the two nights previous at a budget hotel towards Station Sloterdijk. If we had to do it all over again, we would spend the extra money and stay at this hotel. The rooms are HUGE (about the typical size of North American hotel rooms, which is huge by European standards) and it was so conveniently located. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, but the rooms were a little bit worn and needs some updating. But really, you're staying here not so much for the room but because of its great location. Located very close to the Red Light District, Chinatown and of course to Centraal Station and the metro station which gives you access to all the trams, buses and subway trains to take you to all the places you want to go. We took public transport everywhere as it runs very efficiently and saved our feet. We found that restaurants here were more reasonably priced (perhaps it's because it's near the Red Light District and the Chinatown part of Amsterdam) than other, more tony areas of Amsterdam. There is also an Alber Hejn supermarket nearby in Nieuwmarkt, which is about a 7 or 8 muinute walk from the hotel. Great place to get drinks and snacks and food at much cheaper prices than at the overpriced restaurants and cafes in Amersterdam. The hotel is also located about a 12 to 15 minute walk (walk north across Prins Hendrikkade and then across the bridge) to the new Amsterdam Public Library where you can have free access to computers and the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, loud with unhelpful staff-Not my idea of a Palace”
Reviews.Author: jalexoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night on a stopover. It was a Sat night so was fairly busy. The hotel is opposite central station which is only 15-20 mins by train from Schipol aiport (cost EU 3.70 pp). So convenient for a quick stopover. I booked and paid in full in advance online. When we arrived apparently the room I booked (with a king bed) was no longer available (not sure how- when I booked [and paid] a month in advance). They gave us a double bed and allegedly 'upgraded' the room to compensate for the absence of a king room. I seriously doubt this room was an upgrade. It was also very very noisy with night club music. When we asked to be moved to another quieter room with a king bed, our request was denied (and rudely so). This part of Amsterdam is good if you want to be right in the middle of the action and don't mind intoxicated tourists on your doorstep, but I find it very seedy. We stayed the previous weekend at Ibis which was much better location, value for money (about AUD 170 p/night) and better service (and included breakfast which even for AUD 250 for 1 night you don't get breakfast at Barbizon Palace). BTW other than the lobby (which doesn't translate to the rooms in terms of quality and decor), the hotel is definitely not 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Renatron
Reviews.Content: Just got back on Monday after staying at this hotel for 2 nights. Bed was massive and so comfy; TV had BBC1 and 2 (might not bother people if your in need of a quite night after a hectic day or waiting on wife to get ready it fills the time nicely!); ice machine was right outside our door, so was nice for some chilled water; room was spacious and shower was good too Overall the hotel was fairly pricey but you cant beat the location. Our room was to the right side of the hotel and there was a bit of noise when we went to bed on the first night but it quietened down at about 1 am. Along the lane to the right of the hotel were some excellent places to eat asian food and also great wee cocktail bar called the lime bar. Highly recommended. Due to our flights arriving early in the morning and leaving late at night the hotel allowed us to store our luggage there free of charge, which was very handy. This was our second time staying here and will defo be back. If you have any questions, I'd be happy to try and help.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location for station.”
Reviews.Author: Matt89898
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing with the marble floors and very helpful staff. We asked the conceirge to recommend a restaurant and they suggested a super little dutch restaurant. They were very helpful with advice about tourist information. The only problem was that the ceiling in the room was quite small and this meant that my head was through the ceiling when I was standing in the shower which was annoying. I am 6 foot 2 and for someone smaller than 6 foot in would probably be just about suitable. The hotel staff would not change the room until the next day but were willing to allow us to swap. On the whole a good hotel for someone under 6 foot.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Central Station”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller0907
Reviews.Content: Chose to use airport shuttle (15 euro) to get to hotel because I didn't want any hassles after such a long flight - had no problems, driver new exactly where to go. Even though I arrived around midday, I was able to check in immediately which was fantastic! Staff were friendly. I had a room overlooking the canal, which was nice. Room was very clean, bathroom was very clean - lovely toiletries - razor, small hairbrush, toothbrush supplied in case you had forgotten yours (which can come in handy until you get to the stores). There was a bath and shower (over the bath) so it was nice to soak after such a long flight! Used the thirty minute free internet in the lobby which was fine. Very close to shopping district, Dam Square, Palace etc. My room was very quiet. I walked to the train station and it took me about five minutes. I didn't use the restaurant in the hotel as I was out and about and ate when I was sightseeing. There are many, many restaurants and bars in close proximity to the hotel. There is a small souvenir type shop next door, which you are able to buy water, soft drink etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in a hotel close to transport and also close to sightseeing attractions in Amsterdam. I only used the hotel as a stopover, but wouldn't have a problem using it for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NYtravel12
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I have stayed here when coming to Amsterdam. Good hotel, room rate was good, hotel rooms were clean, staff were helpful, location is great. Rooms were a little dark though and furniture needs refurbishing. Overall, still a very good hotel and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Going Back”
Reviews.Author: toPdoG1209
Reviews.Content: We've been to Amsterdam a couple of times now and have not been disapointed yet...The NH Barbizon was a great deal off priceline... The hotel lobby was beautiful and everyone very friendly and helpful gave us bus and tram routes to every destination and attraction we desired. I had called two weeks prior to our arrival to request a king size smoking room for my wife and I and a king size non-smoking room for our friends.When we arrived at 9:00 am from a 9 hour flight we really were expecting them to put us off till the 2pm check-in. Nothing of the sort...We were given a big welcome to the DAM and we've been expecting you and your rooms are ready!!!! WOW!! That was awesome. Our room was right on the street and i had read horror stories about sleepy near the street...It too was the best thing ever. We opened the window "Mild November" and left it open the entire 8 days we were there. We've already started planning our next visit and absolutely will stay here again, especially if the room rates don't jump to high.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: SkyyBoy
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, I was told they had no record of my reservation. I quickly went to the booking website, and learned that the booking agent I used (1800hotels.com) had gone bankrupt. The hotel employee at check-in then told me that the best he could do is make me a new reservation at the "rack rate" which was over US$250 a night. I then used my smartphone to book a new reservation via the NH Hotels website (at about US$130 a night). When I went back to the same employee to check-in, I showed him the confirmation number given to me by the NH Hotels website. The employee then became agitated, and proceeded to give me what I assume is the worst room in the hotel. My room was very small, on the 2nd floor, and was in an alleyway and directly above a bar. The noise from the bar went on until at least midnight & the room was so small that there was not even a place to put my one piece of luggage without it interfering with walking into the room. Also, the in-room WiFi is EXPENSIVE and wanted me to pay separately to get internet access for my iPhone and iPad. It would not let me login with the same password for both devices, telling me that I had to pay AGAIN for the second device. What a rip-off! To their credit, the hotel is clean and has a GREAT location right across from Centraal Station and right next to the Red Light District. Just hope you don't have to deal with the same employee as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: mon82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located in the touristy side of Amsterdam and less than a 10-minutes walk from the train station. There are also bus stops all around the hotel. Overall the hotel is nice. Nothing really wow about it, but itâ€™s good, convenient and comfortable. My room was tiny and unfortunately overlooked the hotelâ€™s lobby area, so I had to keep my curtains closed all the time otherwise people would have full view of my room! However, some of my colleagues had some pleasant rooms, like overlooking a canal or something. The bed is pretty small too - hope you don't fall off the bed at night! The hotel puts all sorts of amenity kits in the bathroom â€“ shaving cream and razor, bath sponge, toothbrush and toothpaste, in addition to the shampoo, soap, etc. The concierge desk is very helpful. I had dinner at the restaurant once, and it was fine â€“ pretty expensive though. The issue I faced is the people working the front desk. Itâ€™s a hit or miss with them. Some are nice, some you want to avoid. The hotel has 30 minutes free wi-fi. You just have to ask the front desk and they will give you a piece of paper with a code on it. There is no sign whatsoever around the hotel that says â€œlimit one per dayâ€� or something like that. So, one evening I happened to get a code. Then, later that night when I came back from dinner, I asked for another to check my e-mail quickly. The guy working the front counter was like, â€œdidnâ€™t you get one already. Itâ€™s only one per day.â€� Then he slammed the paper on the counter (giving it to me). Furiously rude was his answer and attitude. I didnâ€™t comment and it wasnâ€™t worth it to have an argument about 1) his attitude, and 2) no signage whatsoever that says â€œlimit one per dayâ€�. Overall, the hotel is in a convenient location. Not "wow this is amazing"; itâ€™s a very basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location . . . Perfectly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFGlen
Reviews.Content: Not sure Iâ€™d go â€œ5 starsâ€� on the Barbizon Palace, but we loved the location and found the hotel modern, clean and with charming, comfortable, large rooms. (The location is across the street from Central Station, an easy walk from the Cruise Ship terminal, and just at the head of the main shopping, drinking and tourist streets). Bath facilities were outstanding, something unusual for Europe in general and in Amsterdam, in particular. Staff was friendly and accommodating, (housekeepers were great!), even managing to arrange an early check-in for us â€“ much to our surprise. The gym, by the way, is one of the best hotel gyms Iâ€™ve seen, although it seems relatively unused and we were surprised when they charged a fee, (reduced because we were a guest), for its use. We received 30 minutes of free WiFi, which worked fine, although it always amazes me that hotels charge for the service and make it difficult with obscure log-ins and passwords. Breakfast was horribly over-priced. We opted out. There is coffee in the rooms and there are plenty of good places just outside the hotel. The only criticism: Having disembarked from a 10 day cruise, we sent out a small bag of laundry and were stunned at the $50 cost . . . AND we had to track it down at the bell desk, rather than having it delivered to our room. Bottom line: A good, solid, easy hotel, very well located, where we will stay when we next return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonLJH
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through last minute and it was a secret hotel so we didn't know where we were staying until the confirmation came through. Once confirmed i was nervous as there were mixed reviews on the site, however, i have to say i was pleasantly surprised! The hotel is in a perfect location, within ten minutes walking to Dam Square, Neuiwmarkt etc...... the breakfast was lovely and the fact it was open to 11am was a really bonus, there was lots of choice and it was all self service. the staff were extremely friendly, the room an excellent size, and was quiet as we requested. the late checkout of 5pm?! was a real bonus, i would highly recommend this hotel for anyone doing a weekend in Amsterdam...!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - 5*”
Reviews.Author: m_t2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice hotel. Services are good, the rooms are very clean. The breakfast was not included in the price and, I think that a little bit expensive in the hotel. But, it is absolutely no problem to find place to have a breakfast in the center of Amsterdam. The place of the hotel is in the center of Amsterdam, near to Central Station. Very friendly staff, quick check-in & check-out services. So, I would like to recommend this hotel to all!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not what I would expect from 5*.”
Reviews.Author: FKuchar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for seeing the sights of Amsterdam and travelling to and from the airport (the main train station is across the road and regular, fast trains run right to the airport). We booked with Laterooms.com and therefore the price of the room was significantly lower, however we would have expected a little more from a 5* hotel. Compared to other 3 and 4* hotels we have stayed in we were surprised that there was not free WI-FI access in the hotel rooms and thr room we stayed in (205) was a little bit shabby (marks on walls etc). The WI-FI in the lobby was also problematic. We would have liked to have been able to order one film on the Pay-per-view system rather than 24 hours. We were also not offered any help with our bags or shown to our room when we checked in - fine for us but maybe not for all guests who may require assistance. The gym/spa facilities cost extra. In general however the hotel is a good option. Staff were polite, toiletries are excellent and the rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable but would prefer not to go back”
Reviews.Author: ChristianB
Reviews.Content: Very dated hotel in excellent location. Rooms are clean but in desperate need of an update. The corridors stink of smoke. The staff allowed us a 4 pm checkout on Sunday which was very handy. We did not try the breakfast or the dining room. I booked the trip through hotwire and got a reasonable rate. However, I intend to contact hotwire and tell them they should not list this property as a 5 star hotel. This hotel is an acceptable solution if everything else in the price range up to 150 euro is sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RickyD73
Reviews.Content: Having Stayed at the NH Musica (Amsterdam) previously I was a little surprised at the quality of room I was initially allocated. A polite request for another room resulted in a move to an apartment across the way. The advantage of this, slightly more "established", hotel is the location. Everything that this city has to offer is a bike ride/ tram ride away - if not within walking distance. The NH Musica was modern and fresh but stuck in the business district - so not ideal for sight seeing but doable if you work the trams out. NH Barbizon's main attraction has to be the Location. You know that NH are a decent brand who offer very good friendly service. So I would stay here again. The Jazz trumpeter, Chett Baker, died a short distance from this hotel by the way. Not a lot of people know that. My top tip from this break - find the Hermatige Museum - they have a great Restaurant which was open for the evening on the Saturday i was there - great service and a no nonsense menu. Go there for the hearty casserole for two and a classy glass of wine - before everyone else hears about it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: LizzieL78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of June, having actually booked in to the NH City Center hotel. However when we arrived at the City Center hotel we were told they were overbooked and had booked us into this hotel instead, the receptionist arranged for a taxi to take us to this hotel free of charge and they honoured the rate we had booked at the City Center Hotel. This hotel is pretty much opposite Central Station in Amsterdam and is well located for wandering around the old quarter, the red light district and for lots of bars and restaurants. We only used a tram once during our entire stay but these were easily accessible from near by the hotel if you wanted to use them. Our room was on the first floor at the front of the hotel and with the window open was very noisy, luckily we had air conditioning in the room and used that to keep the room cool throughout our stay. The double bed was two twins pushed together with separate bedding on each one but were very comfortable. The room had a TV (showing BBC1 and BBC2 for British Guests!), a kettle, lots of complimentary toilitries, one bathrobe, a minibar, an ironing board and iron etc. The room was big for a city centre hotel in Europe. The bathroom was spacious with a shower above the bath, though the bathroom could have done with some basic remedial work to make it a little more modern. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom but the light up mirror next to it didn't work. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but there were lots of places to get something from locally. We had a couple of drinks in the bar one night, they were normal hotel prices. There are lots and lots of places to eat and drink close by and would definietly recommend the 'Bird' thai restaurant a short walk from the hotel. If you want a well located hotel, which is perhaps a little dated, but convenient for Central Station then I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable 4* with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Diplomatico
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night toward the end of June. As previously mentioned, the location of this hotel is fantastic. It's right across the street from Centraal Station, easy access to tram and metro, within walking distance to plenty of pubs, restaurants, and tourist sites. I was able to obtain the room for US $89 bidding on Priceline. Since Priceline books double rooms on all bids I received a double room which was larger than I expected and quite comfortable. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, I had one of the rooms facing an indoor courtyard but that didn't really matter much to me. Granted, the room decor was a bit dated but everything worked well. Room had a safe (free), iron/board, robe, internet access that I didn't use because it cost more than I wanted to pay. Free 30 mins of internet access is available in the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful and I was allowed to check in very early (8:30 a.m.) upon arriving from the U.S. on an overnight flight. The breakfast is expensive in the hotel so I skipped it and went instead to the restaurant 'de Kroonprins' (left of the hotel's front door, has the Statue of Liberty on top of the overhang) for breakfast. Nice European spread (i.e., some hot food like scrambled eggs and beans but mostly cold food) that was all you can eat for EU9.50. Recommended. For the price I paid, I was more than happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the action, quiet, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tonypu
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to the action. Room cool clean and comfortable. Our first night we were tired from traveling over the pond. Freshened up with a hot shower and a short walk up to the avenue. Had a drink in the bar area, and then a great dinner. After a good nights rest and a fine breakfast buffet, so many choices. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely situated in city centre, opposite of train station”
Reviews.Author: DreBer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. Room was confortable but we had no "outside" window. The window we had opened to the inside reception square of the hotel. No fresh air for us that night as we are used to sleep with windows open all seasons. This is not 5 star quality. Breakfast was superb, a fantastic choice. The hotel location is very good. Opposite of the central train station, which also includes trams and metro (tube). The sight seeing boats are situated within a 10 min. walk. Also the city centre is close by (walking distance). Nice hotel, but next time I'd make sure to have a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “It's Ok but not Great”
Reviews.Author: snwong48
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on the rate I got soI guess I can't complain too much but: Plus: 1. Great location near the central station which is great if you plan on traveling around Holland or even Belgium 2. The staff can be helpful but this does not apply to everyone. Some seem pretty standoffish 3. They allow a 5pm check out on Sunday which was great especially since our flight out was only at 830pm 4. Free internet and wi fi in the lobby. Minus: 1. Besides the station, there really isn't very much around hotel albeit it is just a 5-8 minute walk to Dam Square 2. The rooms are very dated. Looks like they were decorated in the early 80's. It really is time for a refurbishment. The wadrobes in the room were a joke and could not be shut properly. The complimentary coffee and tea was a "bad", for a hotel that claims to be a 5 star establisment, I think they can provide better quality stuff. 3. You have to pay to use the gym. In a nutshell,I would not really stay there again unless I get a really good rate. And it is not a 5 star hotel, not by anyone standards, whether Asian, European or American.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, opposite Central Station”
Reviews.Author: Stacey_GR
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised to see that the NH Barbizon Palace was better than most reviews I've read. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfy, sleep was excellent...the breakfast was amazing!! worth every penny...We've booked our rooms through an Interner broker and got a very cheap price per day, so it was worth it!!! Got 5 star treatment for a 2 star price! Given that Amsterdam is one of the most expensive cities, I would definetly stay there again. The staff was courteous and helpful, eager to please and provided great service. I stayed there for 5 days...only minus was that in once occassion, a room service order was misplaced and never received...any how, the rooms could be a bit more modern...but had a breathtaking view of the canals and the Central Station...everything was in walking distance, the lobby was great..the restaurant was great...so all good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and perfectly decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bretcisco
Reviews.Content: For a first trip to Amsterdam, I figured it made sense to stay at a hotel near Central Station. It was a wise choice. The Barbizon Palace is within eyeshot of the station, and very close to many fun areas; also an easy point to venture anywhere in the city. Staff is friendly, rooms are clean, and service is fine. This is a European five-star hotel, and by American standards, probably a four. If you know this going in, you will not be disappointed in the accommodations at all. This is also one of the few nice hotels in all of Amsterdam that have smoking rooms available. This hotel (unlike many others in Amsterdam) do not charge you to watch television and have efficient elevator service. Oddly, some rooms at the hotel have windows that open and some rooms don't -- so request by e-mail any specifics like this that you want (in addition to upper floors with nicer views at no extra cost--5th floor is nice--a quieter part of the hotel, etc.) and they will acommodate you if they can. They are very helpful. The concierge was terrific with every question and bit of information I ever needed. Considering the price, location, and overall needs for this trip, I have no complaints whatsoever about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “By no means a 5 star property”
Reviews.Author: DeniseK
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a flying visit of Amsterdam. I chose this property as the location next to the Train Station suited us as we only had 1 night. If i was staying in Amstedam for more then 1 night I would seek an alternative location. On check in I specifically requested a quiet room and I was told by the male front desk member that the room was quiet. the room was on the second floor looking out on a street full of pubs!! I couldn't believe it. I was very disappointed that all i was given on check in was lip service and not customer service. I was eventually allocated a quiet room and I found the front desk staff rude and by no means accommodating. The lobby area is very nice and could be rated as 5 star however the bedrooms (the 3 I did see!!) are shabby, dated and have would pass as 3 star bedrooms. The bathroom was very basic and it didn't even have hand towels. I could have seen past the poor standard of bedrooms if I had received better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hardly a 5 star property”
Reviews.Author: thearts
Reviews.Content: Without exception, the location of this hotel is excellent. Easy to get to from the train station and easy to walk to most of the main destinations in the city. I can't figure out why it has a 5 star rating. More like a 3 star. Service was good. We had a problem with our room, and it was taken care of immediately by giving another room, which was an apartment just around the corner. I recommend booking the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Really a 3 star hotel/concierge but 2 star rooms”
Reviews.Author: LKB113
Reviews.Content: I got an incredible deal so I was excited to stay at the property even though I knew it wasn't going to be anywhere near 5 star US standards from the reviews. Even for a slightly boutique-y European 3 star the price was great (And included breakfast), and that's basically what I expected a slightly higher end Euro style 3 star with a restaurant. I was very disappointed. The cons that make me give it 2 stars. - the mattress was about 1 inch thick and you could feel every single coil - it was very warm in the room and no a/c as they only turn it on in the summer (which I understand), however windows were nailed shut on the third floor, woke up sweating every night. - the bureau door was off of it's track a bit which required you lift it and drag it across to get to your clothing. - lastly my husband used the iron to iron a shirt, the iron was so old and poorly cared for it stained his shirt with rust. The breakfast was sufficient but nothing to write home about. On the plus side, all of the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Now if they could just remodel the rooms, replace the irons, and allow a guest to crack a window!

Reviews.Title: “5 star Barbizon "Palace"...”
Reviews.Author: skolo
Reviews.Content: I was staying for one night in NH Barbizon Palace in the city center of Amsterdam. I hope I will never return to this hotel. I can understand old building but what about the rooms? My shower was sinking, wardrobes had broken handles, it was noisy from the street. And what the hell with the internet in a 5 star hotel? Why do you have to pay for everything!!!???They cant even make it free for the guest when they charge you 230 euros!!!!! per night. I have been in NH Atlanta and

Reviews.Title: “Except For Being Locked In Room Stay Was Perfect”
Reviews.Author: wingate
Reviews.Content: When i arrived at the hotel i asked for a quiet room.I was given a room on the fourth floor.Having unpacked i decided to go out only i could not open the door.I phoned reception and they said that they were going to move me to a quieter room.So the concierge came and helped me down to room 136,which overlooks the foyer.This room was very quiet.the only disadvantage being that it was a bit gloomy.I was on my own and the room was a spacious double.The bedroom was a bit dated but the bed was soft and comfortable.the bathroom with shower/bath was of fairly recent origin.I read the recent comments about the breakfast.I can only say that when i went in each morning it was fully stocked and the hot items under tureens.i thought that it was fully satisfying.The hotel is opposite the station and near to all the main sites.I got a great deal Â£240 for 3 nights.If i go to Amsterdam again and i would stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather sleep in my car in a service station than come here again”
Reviews.Author: Mattt_W
Reviews.Content: Arrived 8pm on a Tuesday evening, tired and hungry, to be told that the restaurant had closed early as it was quiet. Not a good start. Had to make do with a small, overpriced square of greasy lasagne in the bar, not feeling comfortable, as a solo female traveller, to walk around Amsterdam alone looking for dinner. Service in the bar was slow, but the evening improved when a couple of musicians came in off the street & performed a few numbers until they were asked to stop by the management. Not much sleep overnight, as the duvet was less than 3' wide (about 2/3 the width of a normal single duvet), so there was a cold draught seeping around the edges. Pillow menu was a nice touch though. Breakfast very disappointing- some withered, luke warm items on the buffet, at an ideal temperature for breeding bacteria. Little else to choose from to justify the exorbitant price. Lastly, when I checked out, I was stung with a bill for over Â£40 for one night's car parking. This was not mentioned to me when I asked about parking before I booked, nor when I arrived & the car was parked, or when I checked in. To charge this without warning, on departure, just added insult to injury. The only good thing about this hotel was the apologetic & helpful girl on reception.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Redaoife
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Barbizon Palace for three nights with my partner and two friends. We received an excellent rate for the three nights by pricing around with an excellent breakfast included in the room rate. The hotel is ideally located across from the Central station and within walking distance of all the main sights. I had read previous comments about hotel staff but I was extremely happy with the service we received from check in to cleaning and concierge! The concierge was more than happy to book reservations for us and give us directions. The room was nice not european standard 5 star however it was clean and had all of the amenities you would expect. If you are a light sleeper request an inside room as the facade of the hotel is facing building works and bars etc so can be a little noisy but the hotel staff were more than happy to change my room. I would reccomend this hotel and I would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: marypmcc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days in Barbizon Palace. Location is perfect, across from Central Station where you arrive from the airport. In addition you are within 5 minutes of Dam Square, many of Amsterdam's attractions and lovely restaurants. The hotel is very comfortable and has an excellent breakfast, continental and hot. Lovely fresh fruit, try the waffles and cherries! Our room however was quite small for a double but after I spoke to the reception staff we were very graciously upgraded to a luxury room which was enormous and had lovely doors opening out onto the canal. The bar is really relaxing, low lighting and music to soothe your weary feet after you day sightseeing, they do warn you about this!! Bathroom has everthing you need even if you forget your toothbrush and shaving gear! Fully equiped gym but was a little disappointed to have to pay 12E. All in all a very good experience and we would definitely stay here again. Do read about Amsterdam before you go there are so many interesting things to see including the narrowest houses, just the width of the front door! And don't forget a wander down the red light district, not far either from the hotel! Apart from the obvious attractions!, it is a lovely part of the old city. Take a canal cruise and maybe the yellow bike tour. Definitely visit the Anne Frank house, it is so emotive. Eat at "Bird" Thai restaurant in Zeedijk, alongside hotel and "New King" Chinese in same area, both are excellent but they are very popular and busy so you might want to book.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Brilliant Breakfasts, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: modestyblaise4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husbands 40th, the hotel is lovely, unfortunately we had a room on the 1st floor so we were still awake at 3.00am due to loud music from pub across the street!! We complained to reception and after breakfast were moved to a complimentary suite! We got a 3 night deal with continental breakfast included, we would definitely stay here again, good location opposite central station and near all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: In-love-with-Bonaire
Reviews.Content: The Barbizon is a very beautiful and hospitible hotel. We had a lovely, very big room, at the backside of the hotel: nice view on the houses at the canal and very quiet. The staff was very friendly, the breakfast (room service) was delicious. Take the Hop On Hop Off Boat (in front of the hotel) to the Hermitage: geat sail and great museum!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Phillmac1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in mid December on a weekend break to the city. Great location across the road from the Centraal train station and right on the edge of the red light/ Chinese quarter of the city. Staff were very knowledgable and helpful and check in was a breeze. The room was large, clean and had all the facilities we expected; large bed, big screen tv, robes, mini bar, hi-speed internet. Rooms were of a very good standard and very clean. Our stay package did not include breakfast and at 25 Euros each for the buffet it seemed a little steep, we ate breakfast at a cafe adjacent to the hotel for 8 Euros each so saving quite a lot of money and being full for the rest of the day. We did not eat at the hotel as there are so many restaurants and bars in the immeadiate vicinity, we were spoilt for choice, but I understand the hotel does have a Michelin starred chef running the restaurant. The location was ideal for exploring the city, being opposite the train station and almost at the top of the Damrak, so we had the touristy bits of the red light area with restaurants and bars to explore on hand and everywhere else being within easy walking distance. We were able to have a late check out at 3pm which was ideal as our flight was not until 6pm and this gave us nearly another full day. A great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location !”
Reviews.Author: Salouqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one single night at barbizon palace with a ''welcome back voucher'' We got a beautiful big room in the front of the hotel. large windows along the whole side of the wall. Location is great, near the central station and a 5 minutes walk from the ''Dam'' and Shopping area. You should really try the restaurant of NH in the city, '' the 5 flies'' really really great. one thing I did not like was the breakfast, way too busy and not worth the money you are paying for. Just go into the city and find a nice little cafetaria / coffee shop ( real coffee shop ;-) ) and have breakfast over there. would definately return to this hotel again !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: motorbikenut
Reviews.Content: Had a good deal with Thomas Cook for this hotel - Â£80 b/b for the wife and I. Excellent location just opposite the central station meant that it was a short train ride from Schipol and we were at the hotel. We had previously stopped at a NH hotel in Cuba and the Barbizon lived up to our expectations completely. Good room, excellent breakfast ( including champagne and smoked salmon) . Reception and all staff friendly. The central location of this hotel meant that all major attractions were within walking distance. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but only a double bed"”
Reviews.Author: Surrey-Paul-69
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel Excellent Location Excellent check-out policy on a Sunday. But had a double bed, I would have expected a kingsize / queen size for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if you get a good deal!”
Reviews.Author: katjoeuk
Reviews.Content: We were very wary of this hotel after we'd read numerous negative reviews on Tripadvisor, and we thought the price we got here on Agoda was a little too good to be true! We couldn't have been more wrong - everything was great, from the check-in to the room (which was perfectly fine and didn't look run down at all, nor did it have a funny smell) to the WONDERFUL breakfast which was included (and there was absolutely no confusion about that, either) to them letting us stay until 5 pm on the Sunday!! The location is obviously great as well, it's really easy to get to the hotel from the airport and back, and you can walk anywhere in town. I wouldn't pay the full price, but if you get a good deal like we did, book this hotel and get yourself a treat. I don't know what those other people expect when they trash this place - unless there is a whole other part that we didn't see, but we were honestly expecting their least desirable room for the price we paid and it was fine. I guess some people actively look for something to criticize, but believe, I don't take you-know-what and I would complain if there was something to complain about (I had gotten myself all prepared for that, but it was nice not to have to do it!). We booked on agoda, got a great deal and had a lovely stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ishotamagnum
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a large group of us travelling for a stag weekend and paid Â£80 per room per night. The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. Check in and out was very smooth. The breakfast service was outstanding. The rooms were slightly dated but clean and with the expected facilities.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but nothing more...”
Reviews.Author: MadsCopenhagenDK
Reviews.Content: First impression was really good - the reception/lounge bar area looks quite newly refurbished. Check-in went smooth - and my room was already ready (at 12.30). The room however was a big disappointment. It's clean and it isn't really worn down - but it is just completely outdated. The aircon doesn't really work - so the reception has equipped me with an electrical heater. Bathroom also looks a bit worn down and outdated - although it seems to be clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly assisting with the heating problem and directions to various sites. WLAN quite expensive - â‚¬18 for 24 hours - rip off!!! All in all - an OK hotel - fab location right next to the main train station and 10 min walk from the shopping area - and the same to the coffee shop/red light district if that is the purpose of the stay...

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: KiwiBrazilianPom
Reviews.Content: Apparently it was my fault for not asking for a room which was quiet. Non-stop street noise with non-existent sound proofing. Rude check out staff who felt it was part of their job description to argue the point with me after I had only slept 2 hours. Customer service basics missing.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for appointments”
Reviews.Author: YingYang66
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on its location, convenient to the central train station. We had numerous appointments around the Netherlands which required daily train trips to other cities in NL. We were close by the station and able to make early departures and late returns. We arrived early one morning and were happy to find that our room was available at 8am for our booking that next night. The room was very clean and tidy. Bathroom toiletries of a very high quality. Towels fluffy and plentiful. We enquired of the concierge some assistance on a couple of occasions and received the info we need. We saw very few other guests. Our rate didn't include breakfast so we easily picked up breakfast on the way to the trains. EURO3 for coffee & croissant at the railway station. The hotel does have a fitness centre. This is however at an additional charge of ~ EUR15 per day which surprised me and I didn't pay it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, room and location!!”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located across central station in Amsterdam, about 3 minutes walking from there, so as well in the middle of the city centre. The staff was really helpful, within a second you get what you request. Also the rooms are spacious, clean, a lot of amenities and well equipped, although bathtub should be a bit bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel but unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: momobb
