Reviews.Content: Extremely convenient location, just opposite to Amsterdam Central Station. A nice clean hotel with large room and large toilet. Confortable beds. Too dark at night because the lightings not enough. Staff not friendly at all. Difficult to see anyone smiling face in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: DCgirl520
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was our third and final stop on our Europe trip, and the NH Barbizon Palace was the most expensive hotel we stayed in on our trip--- it was so not worth what we paid. The room was right below average at best. The bed was old, there were stains on the walls, curtains, chairs, and carpets. It just looked OLD. We had a door that opened up to overlook the street-- we couldn't get the door to close! So at night we heard every noise from the alley below. Also, each night I woke up with spider bites. I left Amsterdam with a total of FIVE spider bites!! Ugh! The location was awesome, though. It was next to the Central Train Station, and right next to many shops and good restaurants. The location of the hotel is not enough to bring us back. Our money could have been spent better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better Hotels in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: I_Like_Gooood_Hotels
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, but that's all. We stayed here with business colleagues as a group but the hotel staff was confused and did not realy know what to do. In the morining the bill was all wrong. The rooms are old and worn out. Internet access is not free, it should be if you are a 5 star hotel. The room had a window but all you see is an other hotel room, now external view, like you are on a boat or something. Strange old building. The bed was small and not comfy at all! I say an overpriced 3 star hotel. Look for something else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and laid back”
Reviews.Author: madirish70
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Honeymoon for 3 nights.Well looked after on checking in by the charming affable and professorial,Stan.A top very spacious room with a king size bed on the 5th floor with a wonderful view of the comings and goings of the Station,The Sun din't set till after 10 and was beautiful streaming in an covering the room in a soft amber light.Very Romantic especially with the accordions playing 5 floors below.Thanks again Stan et al for a Memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Oisine
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last weekend and could not fault anything with this hotel. Location excellent, - close proximity to everything, staff were lovely and couldn't do enough for you. Concierge great, breakfast was all you could wish for (champagne was a bonus!) Rooms were spotless and spacious. Room also had a great shower. I'm afraid I have nothing negative to say about this hotel as it made my first visit to Amsterdam very pleasurable. I didn't experience any of the negative stuff people mentioned before. In fact, it was the guests I found rude most of the time and not the staff! I will definitely stay at this hotel again and am already planning my next trip to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful accomodations!!”
Reviews.Author: Buddy1213
Reviews.Content: Th hotel is centrally located in the city, right across from the Central Station, so all types of travel around the city is easily accessed. The room was very clean and nicely accessorized. The staff is very friendly and everyone speaks English. Any type of food that you would desire is in the area. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but definately need rooms updated”
Reviews.Author: PetalEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, close to station and red light district. Room needs updating. They are NOT 5 star. Liked the fact you can extend your stay on a Sunday and check out at 5 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches and a pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: ar85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on my way back to the UK from Utrecht. It's in an ideal location opposite the centraal station, but I didn't have any problems with noise (and I'm a light sleeper). It's close to the red light district, but as a solo female traveller I never felt intimidated. The room (which was specially designed for women on their own) was a really cute quirky room on two levels, with good toiletries and magazines. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast wasn't included in the price I paid (I got it as a secret hotel from lastminute.com) but I had it anyway and it was an excellent hotel buffet - a good selection of fresh and appetizing food. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you can get a good deal on it - it's not 5* plush as you might expect in other countries, but for the Â£120 I paid it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Bewarned, Beware, *Not 4 Star* - Mutton dressed as Lamb”
Reviews.Author: LondonMidas
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star hotel. Room is rough at the most a three star. Prices are riduclious 200 euros a night. Staff at front desk are rude and do not listen, they are just after your money. Location is good, but that's it. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location especially if you understand the Dutch system for hotel stars”
Reviews.Author: dukektown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Barbizon in July 2009 for a relatively quick business trip. I was able to reserve the property for an incredible bargain price of 50 euros a night through PL. So, as with many other reviews I have made on Trip Advisor, my satisfaction with the stay is somewhat related to the price paid. Of interest, I visited the Tourist Center upon arrival and discovered a last minute reservation at the NH would have set me back over 500, yes 500, euros a night! Check in was an easy and fluid process. There were no issues with the PL reservation, and I was able to check in around 1:30 pm in the afternoon although usual check in time is 3:00 pm. I requested a room on the second floor which was honored. In fact, the front staff mentioned that typically the rooms with a view are loud at night although they have inside rooms that are much more quiet. With that being said, the staff member also mentioned the louder rooms tend to be nicer. So, having brought earplugs (which would have been provided if requested), I opted for the "nicer" room. I stayed in room 247 which is interesting as it includes a small flight of about five stairs for access. No big deal to me, but obviously if you cannot climb any stairs, that could have been a problem. Oh, I do have to mention, as several others have, that the elevator system requires you to insert your room key to activate it. That would normally be fine except that there system is very sensitive. From time to time, I would have to insert and remove the room key up to 20 times before it would actually activate the elevator. Room for improvement concerning that issue! The room was reasonably spacious. If I had to guess it was probably around 280 square feet or so. The bed was very, very comfortable and the pillows were great. There were other pillow options available in the closet if needed. There was an unremarkable television on a dresser. The television included about 30 stations including several BBC options. There was a closet set into the wall and included a safe. Of note, I left the safe open by accident after I left the room one day. Although there was obvious cash, passport, and electronics there, it was all there when I got back after the room had been cleaned by the maid. I appreciate that they have trustworthy staff at the NH Barbizon! The room has a nice bathroom with a tub/shower combo. Relatively spacious and included all the usual amenities. The room did overlook some of the nearby bar scene. Honestly, I rarely heard anything from outside and ended up not needing the earplugs at night. The windows obviously had an extra sound dampening pane installed. The location is almost ideal. It is a very quick walk from the Centraal Railway Station. You can see the hotel immediately as you walk out of the station. It is directly to the right of the Church of St. Nicholas which is an even bigger and more obvious landmark if you need one. I was able to walk everywhere from the hotel even making my way to Vondelpark one day. So, I could not ask for any better as far as location. I did not try either of the two restaurant options at the hotel. There is an Albert Heijn market about a 5 to 10 minute walk away which allowed me to stock my room with some of my favorites (Orangina, stroopwaffles, and cheeses). I do have to mention that people do need to understand the Dutch system for hotel stars might be a little different than those you might be used to. In many countries around the world, stars are simply an indication of the amenities provided. They do not have anything to do with the quality or size of a room. So, in Holland, the NH Barbizon gets 5 stars as it includes 2 restaurants, an elevator, 24 hour room service, parking, etc. If you understand that stars in Holland do not necessarily equate with quality, your stay will be much less frustrating. I would give an American equivalent of 4 stars for the NH Barbizon. There is certainly room for improvement, however, the stay was entirely comfortable and I would not hesitate to stay there again on a future visit especially if a PL deal could be obtained.

Reviews.Title: “4ish* star hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: intrepidlady
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for one night last weekend. The location of the hotel is fantastic especially if you're arriving by train. You can see the hotel from the station so no fussing around with maps and dragging your bags in the wrong direction. Check in staff were nice, polite and helpful. There was a concierge but he made no attempt to take our bags (2 ladies lugging a bag each would surely register the interest of the concierge?!?). Our room wasn't ready so we left our bags in the luggage room and came back later. First things, if you're in Amsterdam for some hassle free sightseeing you could hardly pick a better hotel for location. You could easily come and go throughout the day. We got the key card to our room that evening and the helpful man behind reception told us that checkout was 5pm on a Sunday which we definitely appreciated as we had to get a train at 7pm. The hotel except for the front of house areas are very jaded and dated. However our room was clean and full of all the things you expect from a hotel - tea and coffee facilities, extra pillows, blankets, mini bar, tv, toiletries. I noticed that my quilt cover had two cigarette holes in it which I thought was a bit odd. Surely it should've been thrown out and not used again. We were on 3rd floor over looking a busy road and it was consistently noisy all night. I usually bring ear plugs when staying in a city hotel but this time I forgot and so got very little sleep but the hotel can't be blamed for that. Lots of city hotels suffer from the same problem. Breakfast was included in our room rate and it was good with lots of choice of pastries, salad, meats and cheeses, eggs, bacon etc. There was an automatic hot drinks vending machine for tea and coffee and no-one comes around to ask you what you would like to drink. I would definitely expect a fresh brew in a 5* hotel. All in all, I would consider staying here again but only if I got a good room deal. It isn't a 5* but may be an old 4* at a push. However, if the room was cheap and I was only there for a weekend I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Diwali
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average. What really dissapointed me was the fact that they did not even bother replying my emails. I forgot my mobile phone charger in my room and asked if they found it and if they could send it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: The Barbizon Palace is located within a five minute walk of the Amsterdam Central train station, which is, in turn, a 20 minute train ride from the airport. (It is claimed that the trains leave every 10 minutes and that the trip takes 15 minutes, both of which are slight exaggerations.) The hotel aspires to being 5 stars, with fairly large rooms, concierge service and the like. It has one of those under-used cavernous lobbies. It was for us, anyway, a good value. It doesn't quite make 5 stars, but it is totally acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor value for money - no way near five stars!”
Reviews.Author: Lee_in_Fareham
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for the train station and the red light district if that is what you are interested in. The hotel looks like social housing in the UK from the outside. Inside the lobby area is nice. The lifts look like they have not been touched since the 80s and are very difficult to get to work. The check in staff are not very helpful or polite and insist on taking a cash deposit of 100 euros or keeping your credit card details on file. The room was no smoking but had a very strange smell - kind of chemically and a little smokey. It smelt like people had been smoking int he room and they had tried to mask it with air fresheners. The decor in the room is very very tired and really hasn't been touched since the 70s or 80s. The double room consisted of 2 single beds pushed together. The bathroom was dirty and the kettle did not work. The price of food in the hotel is ridiculous and I would not recommend eating there. I would have been satisfied with the hotel had I not paid about 100 euros a nigt to stay there. I think that is overvaluing te place by almost double.

Reviews.Title: “Was exactly what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: kindredspirits
Reviews.Content: Having traveled Europe before, we have discovered that hotels can be a bit sketchy at times, but this was a pleasant surprise. We spent 2 nights, and on Sundays they let you check out as late as 5pm. Getting here from Schipol airport is a breeze. There is a regular train every several minutes and it is 3 stops to Central Station. From there, you'll have a short walk (5 min max). You will see it from the station when you exit. As you walk out, it is on the left. The distance is short, but you'll have to cross several trolley tracks regardless of which way you decide to go. If you are bringing lots of luggage, it could be a bit trying. The staff is outstanding. Great service. We had read mixed reviews, but one had mentioned to get a 'room on the second floor with a high ceiling.' We did and it was very nice. The high ceiling was the result of having to step down about 4-5 steps almost immediately upon entering the room. The bathroom was on the top level, and the rest of the room was on the bottom of the split level. The view was very nice, we could look out of our window and see a canal and across was Molly Malone's. We chose to sleep with the windows open, so we could hear people laughing all through the night. What a nice place! We found the beds very comfy, the pillows were nice, but square. Didn't ask to change them, we just used those. The bedding is split into two, like a his & hers. I didn't especially like it, but the Mrs. really did. She claims that I tend to hog the covers, so it worked out great for her. The linens and towels were of good quality and the provided soap & shampoo were better than usual. The AC didn't really crank, but it was cool out so we were fine. We like the room to be cooler than most people prefer. The location was ideal for us, close to everything especially the train station. One of the better places to rent bikes (you have to bike while there, and be sure to ring the brrrrrring brrrrrrrring bell) is at the train station. Very reasonable. The hotel is just outside of the red-light district, but you could stay there and never even know it. The elevator requires you to use your room key on the way up, so if you are in it and the doors shut and it doesn't move, eventually you'll figure it out. Not sure that I'd give it 5 stars, but am sure that I'd return without hesitation. Shop around, don't pay retail, and you'll like it all the more. Hotwire worked good for us. One final note about the location.......in Amsterdam, many of the roads are unprounceable and often change names from corner to corner. Although frustrating, maps are almost useless. Not sure if there is even a straight road of any significant distance, all the roads seem winding. Plus, sometimes for sundry reasons you may find yourself with less than normal mental agility from time to time. But with it being near the Central Train station, all you have to do is to ask anyone which way to the train station and you can find your way back to your hotel. As the commercial goes that's......'priceless.'

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sailornep5
Reviews.Content: Won the room through Priceline for $75, and was happy to see how central the location of the hotel was for downtown sights. We were just in Amsterdam for a one night layover, so its extremely close proximity to the train station was great. It was easy to get to/from the Schiphol Airport - just a quick hop on the express train got us there in fifteen minutes for under four Euros each. The hotel was located directly across from Central Station towards the left. Despite the modern decor in the lobby, the actual rooms are pretty outdated (as others have mentioned). Beds were firm but the hotel offered different types of pillows to make it more comfortable. The rooms were spacious but would be equivalent to a US 3* property at best; the 5* rating given is probably a bit of an overstatement. Concierge staff was never around when we needed them, but the front desk was happy to help with directions and recommendations. For the price, I'd definitely stay here given the value and location. I'd probably balk more if I paid the $200+ rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Central !”
Reviews.Author: jimjam76
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay for five nights as part as a birthday treat and had a great time in Amsterdam ! The hotel is really central, directley across from Centraal Station which makes it a little noisy but all part of the buzz of a wonderful city centre. The hotel has a nice check in and reception area , close are the bar and the Resteraunt , which incedentley does the best buffet breakfast I have ever experienced! The choice was fantastic from Hot Cherry Waffles to Smoke Salmon and Cava , along with the old classic hams,cheeses,bacon, sausage and a vareity of eggs ! Its a little pricy but if you get an inclusive rate its definatley worth it. The hotel even runs a lazy sunday offer that gives you breakfast till noon and a five PM check out which is always good. The only slight downside is the old fashioned rooms which are slighty dated and could do with a bit of a refurb . On the whole , would stay there again but prefer the NH Grand Krasnapolsky in Dam square and will try the CitezenM hotel next time I go .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Travel4me1a
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for three nights. Very friendly service, and the hotel was definitely clean. The best part of the hotel was the proximity to Central Station, tram lines, and many of the excursion tour offices and starting points. Additionally some very good restauraunts in the vicinity. The down side was the fact it's called a five star hotel, but the rooms are not five star as they are very plain and out dated. We can't complain because I was able to get a great deal on the rooms for much less than what they advertise...Would recommend, but don't expect it to be a five star...It is though clean, safe, and has good service....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: eurotripper19
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful, the staff is extremely helpful not to mention very very beautiful. The purple candy at the desk is awesome too. Do not drive into the city because parking is upwards of 50+ euros a day. The hotel actually had the cheapest parking around (even cheaper than street parking). So back to location-- it is right across the street from central station which means pretty much any tram in the city will bring you directly to the hotel. The rooms are typical but definitely not worth of 200+euros which is their advertised rate. Ended up booking on priceline for 100 a night- but you may end up in a room on a low floor and no view though. They will charge you an arm and an leg for anything they can though- 8 euros to use the gym, 20 euros for breakfast and 18 for a day of wireless internet. Did I mention the staff was wonderful and extremely pleasing to the eye.

Reviews.Title: “Nice upgraded hotel but don't use the phone”
Reviews.Author: genemean
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been remodeled and is beautifully located. Some sections can be a little noisy though. Bring ear plugs. But, unless it is an emergency do not use the phone. I was charged 23.88 Euros for 5 local phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: fromny
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to central staion & all tram lines. Room very nicely furnished. Amenities included robe, slippers, toileteries, etc

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Elival
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights (8 and 9 May 09). The location is very good, very close to all type of transport. Shops and restaurants at close proximity. The check-in was good, this time unlike the last time we went to Amsterdam (Crowne Plaza), the staff was courteous and quick. It was nice entering the hotel, since outside on the city streets, is quite dirty and but once inside the hotel, the sense of cleanliness is quite obvious. The room was spacious enough, clean and neat. Bathroom was find, toilet requires more thorough cleaning, it was not dirty but they should use some kind of bleach... Hand towels were clean but had stain, they should be replace. Internet is not complimentary neither breakfast, very expensive treat. Just go outside for a bite to eat. No alarm clocks or ipod connection. Bed was comfortable and they can provide pillows as per your request. We requires toothbrushes, and they were promptly supplied. The concierge staff were superb, very helpful and courteous. We organise a shuttle return (connexion group from airport?) and it was 30 minutes late!! this was not the hotel's fault though, they were very helpful calling the company to find out where they were... Anyhow with so much stress we still made it to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ambrosini
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 4th stay at this hotel and once again it was everything we wanted it to be. The location is fantastic, over the road from Central Station and walking distance to all the main attractions. The hotel, as soon as you walk in, gives an air of luxury and peace. Check-in staff are very efficient and polite and many thanks for the upgrade we recieved to a superior room, it was beautiful. The only drawback to the room,which didn't really bother us but may others, was the lack of wardrobe and drawer space. Everything else was perfect. The box of chocolates were gratefully received, I happened to mention on checking in that it was my husbands birthday and the next thing they were left in our room for us,a nice touch. We always stay room only so can't comment on the restaurant but there are so many places to eat you really can't go wrong. I must mention our favourite bar which is just around the corner from the hotel, Molly Mallones Irish Pub. The food here is unbelievable, rib-eye steak with garlic butter to die for and the welcome is always very warm and friendly. It's our first stop each time we go to Amsterdam. Once again we were sorry to leave and are hoping to return again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel - 2 Star Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: Travelers42
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three night stay at the Barbizon. It is a good location as the train station and the trams are just a short walk away. (However, the location is close to the bars which is not a great place to walk around at night when there's not a lot of people around. Weekends are okay as there's a lot of people) The hotel is rated five stars but our room looked more like a motel room. It needed a lot of updating and retiling in the bathroom. Probably could have stayed at a cheaper hotel in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay if you get a special offer”
Reviews.Author: KSOC
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Barbizon for the weekend. Good location (airport transfers, trams, shopping, nightlife), friendly staff, great breakfast which was included. We got it for 3 nights with breakfast for 2 people at 293 euro. Have stayed in other hotels in Amsterdam before and this is probably the best all things considered. On average a 5* hotel in Amsterdam is probably a 3.7* elsewhere. We would return to this hotel. Re previous review- We also stayed in the Victoria before and based on that stay the Barbizon was nicer but it may have been renovated since then (3 yrs ago).

Reviews.Title: “2 min walk from the train station”
Reviews.Author: Feegeeheatlee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sep 08, a getaway with some girl friends. Hotel was directly across the road from the station so easy to get to. Rooms were clean and spacious and the reception was very quick and the girls were friendly. Im sure its advertised as a 5* hotel and i would disagree with this maybe a 4*! Didnt eat in the hotel but did not have a bad meal the whole time I was there plenty nice cafe`s and restaurants everywhere. Would go back there if I was going again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location to visit Amsterdam in a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Malenkij
Reviews.Content: Good location Roomy rooms with warm atmosphere Good Service

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salop83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Barbizon Palace just after new year. This was the first time we had been to Amsterdam. The hotel is very conveniently located near to central station which meant that we did not have to walk too far with our suitcases. The hotel itself was fine. It is a big hotel with business trip kind of feel to it. We had quite a good deal considering this is rated as a five star hotel. However, our room was by no means what you would expect for a 5 star and probably reflected the price we paid. It was small room on the top (fourth) floor which was very badly lit with low celings. On the plus side, it was very clean and all we needed for our stay. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as it was too expensive and we found you get a fry up much cheaper just a short walk away. The best thing about this hotel was the location. We walked to all of the major attractions from there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...Ideal place to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: yaasar
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel.My Second stay here.Good start point to explore amsterdam and surroundings.Opposite the Centraal Station, excellent for Trains,Trams, Bus or Canal Boat. Stayed for 4 nights.Plus they offer smoking rooms,very hard to find in amsterdam nowadays. The Hotel walkways has a worn out feel,rooms were comfy. Tip: If having breakfast here, order in, good enough for two at the price for one at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Wrong Location”
Reviews.Author: El-Paradiso
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Barbizon Palace between Christmas and New Year, which I supose is one of the quieter parts of the year. It seemed it in this hotel anyway as we hardly saw any other guests during our stay. First impressions are good, the hotel looks nice from the outside and sits around 2 mins walk away from the central station. This was ideal for us and the reason for booking this hotel in the first place. Infact after arriving at Schipol airport its around a 20 minute train journey (3 or 4 stops) into Amsterdam Central and is very easy to get tickets/find platforms etc. Most Dutch seem to speak better english than the english do. The area directly across from Central Station is unfortunately a large building site, as are a few other parts of the city, although once you move one street back from these areas the charm of Amsterdam shines through. Once in the hotel we were checked in and able to access our room at mid-day. The service was swift and polite. The reception/lounge area that lies around the entrance is tastefully decorated and provides nice, well lit and quiet surroundings....directly in contrast to the area around the hotel. The rooms, as stated in many other reviews are better than average, but not 5 star. Neither I or my girlfriend could have any complaints other than to say that rooms which overlook the road/central station may experience the odd loud traffic noise, even into late evening...again, this is to be expected and certainly did not bother us too much. Also as mentioned previously, the hotel is close to the red light district. This may not be to some people's tastes, but the more open minded should definately take a look around, especially during the daytime when there are locals and tourists in the area (and not just old men). For those who want to be close to any nightlife, I would suggest that this is not the hotel for you. There are more restaurants and bars around Liedseplein Square than anywhere else in Amsterdam. This hotel is around 5-10 minutes by tram to Liedseplein, with tram stops straight outside central station. Finally I would suggest that people try and eat outside of the hotel as it is generally of a good standard (breakfast) but a little pricey. The cafe at the end of the street is 30 seconds walk away and although not in the same setting as the hotel restaurant serves just as good food. All tastes and pallets are cetered for in town, so I would reccommend heading out for evening meal. Altogether a good hotel, close to the station but a little out of the way from nightlife and certain tourist attractions

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: bcsrule
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room was beautiful, it was one of the special one's with a high ceiling, it didn't look like a hotel room at all. The location was great, near the Central Station. The food was pricey but we never ate there. The desk staff was nice and polite, and concierge had great resturant recommendations. I would stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!”
Reviews.Author: EmCorb82
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Amsterdam and if I'm perfectly honest, it wasn't that great....... We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights (Saturday - Tuesday). It is based in an ideal location for first time visitors as the hotel is located just over the road from Centraal Station and easy to find. The reception area is lovely. It had a modern feel to it and looked great. All of the staff are so helpful and this includes the maid! We arrived early at 12noon and we're able to check in which was a bonus. Unfortunately the room was very average (435). The bed was small, decor ok and the bathroom pretty poor. For the price we paid I really was expecting more. Our bed was less than comfortable. The tea and coffee facilities weren't that great (for a five star I expected more) and the bathroom needed completely redoing. Don't get me wrong, it was clean but the extractor didn't work, the bathroom sink did not drain properly, the grouting was mouldy and the hairdryer was less than powerful! Luckily we didn't spend to much time in the hotel. We didn't eat in the restaurant for two reasons. One being that it looked so cold, empty and lifeless and two, the price of their meals. Amsterdam has loads of options for evening dining so it surprises me that they ever have visitors in there. It's also a huge shame that their breakfast isn't included in the price of the room. I think this would benefit them hugely and is something they should really think about. With all due respect, who is going to pay 22 euros for a breakfast when you can get one just outside the hotel for less than half price - it just doesn't make sense! The bar is lovely and the barman (sorry, I forgot his name) was second to none. The location for the hotel is great to initially find it but once we'd explored Amsterdam we could think of loads of other areas we'd have rather stayed. The problem with this hotel is that it is on the border of the red light district and is quite noisy. Don't get me wrong, the red light district is something to definitely see but do you want to be in the midst of it when trying to find a romantic place to eat - NO! Would I stay here again? Absolutely not. The hotel came to a lot more than we expected and it is not a 5 star hotel by any means. Possibly a good choice for business travellers but for a weekend getaway for 2 I'd steer clear and stay further into Amsterdam and away from Centraal Station.

Reviews.Title: “Where the actions are”
Reviews.Author: DangMontreal
Reviews.Content: Good price/quality ratio for an european hotel. The location is undeniably the best location : train station, shopping area, Chinatown (Zeedijk), gay and entertainment Warmoesstraat are next to the hotel. Breakfast is expensive but the alternative are 1 minute walk away. I have the room 319 with the nice view of the Centraal Station. The maid clean the room as soon as I quit the room. Very nice bathroom and plenty of amenities. Coffee and Iron facilities work very well. I had a very welcome anb fast checkin, less than 5 minutes. The only thing doesn't work well is the card reader in the lift (escalator).

Reviews.Title: “Busy but well run”
Reviews.Author: LiamFitzP
Reviews.Content: In stayed one Thursday night on business and was booked in because it was close to Centraal Station. Quick check-in, spacious standard room (even by US standards) and everything worked well. It's a big hotel and has a mix of punters - including quite a few holiday makers - but I found it to be quiet and rather intimate despite its size. would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you want to be close to the red light district!”
Reviews.Author: Louise_Surrey_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located for the railway station (we were able to walk from there with two very heavy suitcases), and sits right on the edge of the red light district and the city centre. Great, if a little noisy (we backed onto the canal, and busy tourist streets, although it was a hot weekend after a period of terrible weather, so you can't really complain). Excluding the outside noise, the hotel itself was very quiet and peaceful. We had good service at check-in (despite arriving at about 11am), with our room being ready by 1pm. We were also offered late check-out (5pm) at no charge, which we valued greatly. We didn't eat in the Hotel so cannot comment on this(you may wish to check out the very close-by De Compagnon Restaurant for a superb meal - see http://www.toptable.co.uk/venues/restaurants/?id=3542) . The room was well-equipped, though not remarkable in itself, but it was those little extra touches which set this hotel apart from others. A pillow menu, a book of bedside stories, a host of teas and coffees, more complimentary toiletries that you could ever use and some nice magazines and books on the city. The bed was comfy too! I would definitely recommend the hotel and stay there again, but would ask for a room less likely to be affected by outside noise!

Reviews.Title: “sometimes good, sometimes bad.”
Reviews.Author: eliman
Reviews.Content: one week before coming i was told that my flight was changed and i'll be in the hotel at 1pm and the rooms will only be ready at 3pm. i wrote to NH and to the hotel asking for the rome earlier - no response (i even suggested paying). i got there and was told (not so nicely i have to say) that the room is not ready. i cam back at 3pm - the room was still not ready. i asked for a quiet room and got a room by the canal which is very noisy, but when i asked another room i got a very quiet and nice room. location is good. can't say i saw this as a 5 stars hotel - maximum 4 stars but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: euro_tourists
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbizon for one nights stay. The location was excellent and really close to the train station - across the street! Our room was on the second floor and was extremely quiet. The room itself was great, spacious, lovely bathroom and with a huge bed! We think that we were upgraded - but are not sure. The cost of the room was Â£120 for the two of us with out breakfast but the slippers and dressing gown supplied added an extra touch to the room. The only warning I would offer people is that the mini bar is automatic!!! We didnâ€™t know this and had opened it to take a look at what was in it - we didnâ€™t drink or eat anything but a 20 euro charge appeared on the bill that can be viewed via the television. We queried this and it was because if you move anything out of the fridge for longer than 10 seconds you are charged for that item!! We felt that this was wrong as we should have been told on check in or a bigger sign should have been on the fridge - it was in tiny writing! It wasnâ€™t even mentioned in the room information. We queried this with the hotel and they reset the bill - I am guessing this must happen a lot. The other small point was that the room was not ready when we checked in at 3.30pm and we were told to come back in 2 hours! For a 5 star hotel this is not really acceptable. However, they stored our luggage and when we got our room it was fabulous with lots of lovely toiletries and sundries. Finally, ask for the late checkout on a Sunday for no extra charge - you can then have the room until 5 pm - which again was an excellent bonus. On the whole - a great stay, a fabulous location and an overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: greeryevette
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days, and found the hotel to be delightful, stunning looking and friendly. Our room was amazing thanks to the lovely manager Karen who upgraded us because it was our anniversary, we even got chocolates. it was amazing with original beams and the lobby was so five star! It was very clean and pretty, the bathrooms are small but ok and have hairdryers. some of the rooms are smoking, ask. The staff are lovely and really helpful! The bar resteraunt is ok but a little pricey. If your in a suite take some cd's because there is a cd player. it was very close to everything, all bars and shops. Warning! Girls DO NOT wear heels unless you have to! or at least take flip/flops in a bag, I wore them out for dinner once and because you end up walking miles your feet will hurt and it's cobblestones. Also go to The Supper club it was amazing!!! what an experience! You eat in beds, and surrounded with ambient music, words cannot discribe it! I've put a pic up it cost us Â£200 but we hadnice wine and alot....it's 5 courses but small portions and you even get masssages! I hope you have a lovely time!

Reviews.Title: “Very strange”
Reviews.Author: Bell084
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some serious customer service problems. I have never in my life met a bartender as rude and vicious as the one that served us. Needless to say we never went back into the hotel bar for drinks again. I asked others in our party thinking it was just an off day and they said he was just as nasty the night before. One morning we had the Do Not Disturb sign on the door. Housekeeping knocked on the door waking us up and since I wasn't fast enouph for them they called on the phone and would not let me go. We told them to please leave our room alone today and later when we were out they came in anyway! A Concierge was also rude to one of our party .

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed at the Barbizon Palace”
Reviews.Author: bonsey3
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice of hotels in Amsterdam. Located right across from Central Station. Which is what we needed since we were carrying around luggage and using the train from Schipol was the best way to get into the city. The hotel itself was magnificent. Very clean, large rooms. Would have liked a street view, but we were never in the room long enough so it didn't really matter. The older Concierge was a brilliant man. Very knowledgeable and never blinked an eye with all of our questions. Even the younger one's were very pleasant and willing to answer our questions. Didn't eat there because we found it much more fun to grab something on one of the many, narrow streets while walking. We only had one full day in Amsterdam. I would recommend at least 2. Will certainly go back and Barbizon Palace will be our choice in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack313
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated perfectly in Amsterdam. We enjoyed the large rooms. As the hotel is made from old buildings (Which are absolutely stunning) the size of the rooms is changing. The staff is very, very helpful. Breakfast with life cooking eggs and absolutely everything you can think of. The best prices through hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: utripmeup
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night for business. Positives is the location. Close to the sights. Rooms are very small and pokey and the rooms need a make over - old and tired. The dinner in the ground floor restuarant was very good. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: getready800
Reviews.Content: We booked a group holiday of 8 lads xmas time 07, thought the hotel was great got a really good deal compared to other hotels in amsterdam and while the receptionist was a bit snotty suppose it was to be expected for group of lads in a 5 star (even though its probs a 4!). Found this hotel pretty standard of other NH hotels the rooms were spacious with large bathrooms and the hotel overall was spotless. The best thing about this hotel is its location hop off the train or bus from central station and its opposite the road and at the back of the hotel is the start of the red light district with a straight walk down to dam square, everything is within walking distance of this hotel and I would really recommend this hotel to anyone staying in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailorMunich
Reviews.Content: I stood there during a business trip. Knew the hotel from a previous stay when it has been a Golden Tulip Hotel. In this times it has been run by a very friendly and helpful staff. My last stay didn'nt make me feel welcome and comfortable. The staff was really uninterested. The quiet room they gave me was above the air-con of the kitchen. So you could'nt open the window. In the first room I tried , the windows were closed for fire-safety reasons. The hotel room itself was quite spacious, with older but comfortable furniture. The allover impression of the room and the bathroom was like in a good 3 star hotel. The breakfast was quite decent, but nothing special or refined. No service at all, they even don't serve coffee or tea at your table. No tea pots or tea cups are available. You drink all hot beverages out of a mug. The hotel is in a very good location next to the central-station and in the heard of the city. The architecture in some old canal houses is quite interesting. But there is nothing above average, neither the rooms the interiour design or the berakfast. The staff is really uninterested. They ask you how you like your stay. But the only reaction on your reply is: Oh !

Reviews.Title: “A good Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisMH
Reviews.Content: I stay in Amsterdam quite a bit and this is my hotel of choice. The Barbizon is located very close to the station and the old town and has a bit of character about it. Many of the hotels in Amsterdam don't alas. The rooms are bigger than others I have stayed at in other Amsterdam hotels and the service is generally pretty good. This is a solid choice for business or leisure when staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3-star than a 5-star”
Reviews.Author: jamesjfoley
Reviews.Content: Looking for a luxury hotel for a fun weekend in Amsterdam, I made the mistake of NOT checking with TripAdvisor first. I've visited Amsterdam many times, so was familiar with the great location off Central Station & Damrak. However, I normally stay at the Victoria or Renaissance (both 4 stars and similarly located). However, this trip I thought I'd live it a little a larger and upgrade to a 5-star, picking the Barbizon Palace due to it's location. What a mistake. While the lobby may merit perhaps a 4-star rating, the rooms are definitely only a 3-star (even for Europe).....worn carpets, sparse bedding, lumpy beds, old furniture, minimalist bathroom, 1980's style TV and pay movie system and no music/hi-fi in the room, Yes, the rooms are of a good size, but just feel so old, tired and badly in need of an upgrade. I was upgraded, but still the new rooms was only minimally better. I understand the suites have been renovated, but I would advise against staying at this hotel until every room had been modernised. In the meantime, if you're keen on this location, check out the lovely Victoria or Renaissance hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent great value”
Reviews.Author: scott1994
Reviews.Content: Just got back after boking with ( Reserveahotelonline.com ) did this via a cash back site ( quidco ) where i will get 5% cash back, Total for 2 of us came to Â£250 for 3 nights bed & breakfast included. this was cheaper than some 3 star hotels (you can check out late on Sundays 17.00hrs free of charge)This is in an ideal location as you come out of the train station look left across the square & you can see the hotel (no need to pay for taxi or mess around on the tram!. in the right place to do all your travels as all transport starts & finishes at the central station so you never get lost.our room 007 was on the ground floor right next to the canal (open the french doors & the ducks swim over to you. slippers & dressing gown provided & all of you toiletries, loverly king size bed, TV. Breakfast is one of the best i have had full choice very clean & fresh. Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful... Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: dp7net
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay in Amsterdam for two extra nights... it was very hard to find but we were willing to pay up to 160 Euros maximum... we fell on the Barbizon Hotel. Its a great location... Excellent food... great design... very clean and great service. Everything you'd expect. I dont put 5 points, because I never believe in perfection... but this was definitely the ideal hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissyGalway
Reviews.Content: I booked a deluxe room and paid 237 euro for one night no breakfast. I was disappointed with the room it was nothing like the internet/hotel pages showed.It was just a large room with a small bathroom old carpet and very old dresser and wardrobe.There was no air conditioning and even the beds were lumpy with old and worn sheets. There was nothing special about this hotel yes the lobby is beautiful and the bar is funky but after that its more 3 star than 5. I had brought my mum with me as a treat for her and that is why i choose the deluxe room. The staff were nice and friendly and the location was great but step beyond this and it is a huge dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Bananaman3m
Reviews.Content: From a logistics stand point, the location is excellent. It is across the square form the metro station and tram station, so the city is at your finger tips. Staff was first rate, and very attentive. While breakfast may be praised in other reviews. 25 Euro is quite dear, especially with the current US currancy translation. There is a great sandwich shop to the left of the hotel where you can get a light breakfast fo 3-6 Euro. Key card access to the elevator is a pain. A good choice at the right price for a first time visitor.

Reviews.Title: “great location amazing breakfast - but: noisy”
Reviews.Author: dutchbob
Reviews.Content: first of all: 5 stars in Europe is 4 in the US, remember that. They DO have a guy to pick up the luggage and valet parking etc. We got an upgrade to a deluxe room, more spacious. Pros: great location - opposite site of the station, next to the Dam shops and everything you want. Amazing breakfast (get the booking.com deal with 1 bf free) yes its 25 euros but the best Ive seen yet and Ive seen a lot, mussels, pancakes, dutch appliepie, enough for a brunch for sure. Room was nice, the usual minibar ironing board everything was there, good and quiet a/c. Cons: bathtub is REALLY small. Elevator with the keycard in first to go up is a bit annoying. Important: this hotel is on the corner of the Zeedijk, the street that ends at the redlight district. Its in the busiest area of Amsterdam. If you want a QUIET hotel, book something further away from the center, cause esp during the weekens its crowded on the streets. Defenitely a hotel wed go back to.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Happy New Year!”
Reviews.Author: minus00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Barbizon Palace over New Year (06-07) and found it to be a superb hotel in the heart of Amsterdam. It's in a great location within walking distance of the Central train station, tram routes and the notorious Red Light District. Considering we stayed at the NH Barbizon Palace over the New Year period we expected the service to be understandably lacking, however we were pleasantly surprised and found the service to be excellent. We ordered two meals by room service, one on New Year's Eve around 2am in the morning(!) and despite one item not being on the menu the chef was kind enough to make it for us. The other meal was breakfast on New Year's Day which was lovely to eat in bed after celebrating the night before. The food was very good on both occasions although I admit it was expensive for what is was. Likewise with the mini-bar however you do have to remember that the hotel is a five star and their prices reflect that. The room was beautiful and spacious - comfortable king sized bed, large television, business / living area with desk and plenty of storage. Tea / coffee supplies were topped up daily and room cleaned regularly (again surprising considering our nights of stay). Marble bathroom was fantastic, well equipped with a large bath and separate large shower, the complimentary toiletries were wonderful too! (a variety of freebies...so nice you actually want to take them home). We didn't experience much noise during our stay even though Amsterdam and the hotel were very busy - we only ever heard a few stray fireworks and bell ringing from the nearby church (which didn't bother me). A great place to stay and a lovely way to welcome in the New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star, but still very nice.”
Reviews.Author: JKMillerInc
Reviews.Content: I should tell you first off that our stay was covered by the trip insurance we bought because of an airline mistake, so know that we didn't spend our own money on this stay. The lobby and reception was great, beautifully decorated and the people were actually quite friendly. A porter brought our bags to our room, and showed us the attractions on a map, suggesting restaurants and how to navigate the red light district. We had a junior suite, with great amenities and beautiful view (room 603). We went out for a bit, (Pinnochio's bar is the friendliest, hottest bar around, just two blocks from the hotel), wandered the red light district (quite strange to do this with your husband, and the girls looked kind of gross), then came back and ordered room service for late night munchies. The spanish tapas were great, the beef/rice dish was nasty and the pizza was cardboard. Otherwise, the room was very quiet, very comfortable. I can't say if it was a great value or not, as we didn't pay for it. BUT...it seemed more like a Marriott than a five star luxury place, so you should only stay if paying three or four star prices, not five.

Reviews.Title: “Request a quiet room”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaBubba
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the recent International Broadcast Convention. I had the noisest room I have ever stayed in. Even with ear plugs I had trouble sleeping. Thursday night was college night in the bars and the weekend was a soccer game. Make sure to request an inside room if you want a peaceful sleep. This hotel is in the convenient location. Red light district is a walk down the alley behind the hotel. Central Station is across the street for surface rail trains. Subway tunnel is in front of the hotel. A breeze to get to the rail train that runs to/from the airport. The DAM is only a two - three block walk. BTW... requested a different room, but the hotel was full all of the nights.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mazzaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel in a standard room. Our room was located at the back of the hotel, and very quiet. Good sized window for natural ventilation, close it of an evening and turn on the A/C and you do not hear a thing. Close to Central station for transport, but far enough away to avoid any problems. Good sized bedroom and bathroom, a little dated but quite comfortable. The hotel breakfast is excellent (although on the expensive side), but there are alternatives outside the front door. Front desk and concierge, pleasant and very helpfull. A good 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore the sins of Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: flushingmeadows
Reviews.Content: I have just spent the last 4 days at this hotel and I will admit that it does not deserve to be 5* BUT I also struggled to fault it. Stayed in room 604, up on the roof with a balcony and good views over the city, seperate living room and toilet connected to the 'sleeping' room. Very comfortable, staff were excellent, hotel was clean and ideally position for strolling around the city of sin(s). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveJayYork
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and were delighted with the room (449). It had a great canal view and the room facilities where exellent with several nice little extra's. The staff were very friendly, helpfull and professional. I would stay here again on any future visit to Amsterdam. We got a great deal via, easytobook.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: kshultz
Reviews.Content: The Barbizon Palace is in a great location within a few blocks walk from the train station....hauling bags was no problem. We stayed in room 233 facing an interior street on a night of one of the big festivals.....the room was pretty quiet. It was a spacious room with great bathroom and amenities. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a mid-priced (199 EU) hotel. Walking to all the major sites is easy and it is within a block of the water ferries as well.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you NH”
Reviews.Author: waterfordmma
Reviews.Content: It was me and my girlfriends first visit to amsterdam and after arriving at our hostel "the white tulip" we decided to check out 5 minutes later, now we were in amsterdam for the weekend with nowhere to stay, frankly the dark alleyways looked more appealing than the white tulip. We walked into the barbizon asking if they had any rooms available straight away, we explained our situation to the girl at the front desk and she gave us one of the suites for the same price as a standard room. The bed was massive and was very easy to sleep on, bathroom was spacious and very clean, we had a view of the canals and central station. The only negative about the barbizon is the bar can be a bit expensive but you are spoilt for choice in terms of nearby bars anyway. Will definitely come back, the hotel is in a lively area and is only acoss the road form the station.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: RetroGuitarBoy
Reviews.Content: I stay in the Barbizon Palace very regularly as I work for a Dutch company and have a need to visit the Netherlands regularly. The Barbizon probably isn't what most people would imagine a 5 star hotel to be - basically it's a business stay hotel in an ultra-convenient location. I've always found the staff to be very friendly and helpful in all parts of the hotel (reception, concierge and in the bar & restaurant). The restaurant does some reasonably good food although they haven't changed the menu for at least 18 months. The breakfast is nice too although it is a little on the expensive side if you are paying for it (22.50 if I remember correctly...). The main reception area is pleasant to look at although I do think that the rooms and corridors need a redecoration as they are getting on a bit, but are still clean and tidy (and more modern than the Victoria hotel across the road). The mini bar is always well stocked although is fairly pricey. Basically if you want to be "where the action is" then the Barbizon is great. Also, amusingly if you are staying on the 2nd floor, the sign for the second floor by the lifts reads "2th Floor"...

Reviews.Title: “functional”
Reviews.Author: imp1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights Aug 2007. Wouldn't class as luxury 5 * hotel, but a perfectly adequate large city centre hotel. location was very central, opposite the station in the busiest part of the City and near the main tourist areas. The red light district is just round the corner so it can be lively at night. My room overlooked a central courtyard so no view to speak of. Room was clean and reasonalby presented, although the bathroom could do with a bit of updating. Very comfortable bed. Didnt have breakfast but you are spoit for choice for eating in the vicinity. Staff were very pleasant and helpful, also flexible on check out times. If you can get a good deal on this hotel (as I did) then I would recommended. However if you are looking top of the range 5* accomodation then it may be worth looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charlville
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hotel a lot for work and for it to have five stars is a little overated. Most rooms are small and dark , and unless you have a room in the inner part of the Hotel the noise at night is very bad. Most rooms are in need of redecoration. I wouldn't recommend it for a holiday trip, bearable for business.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, I guess”
Reviews.Author: tigger83
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and in general, was satisfied. I wasn't over the moon - I cannot say that it's one of the best 5* hotels I've stayed in ... because it wasn't! The room was small (and I'm from the UK and don't expect massive rooms when I go abroad). I've stayed in 4* hotels in the UK which have bigger sized room than the one I was given at the Barbizon. However, size aside, the room was clean and there was an ample supply of complimentary toiletries (including file, sponge, razor, toothbrush, shampoo, conditioner and the list goes on). The hotel was very secure - you needed to use your swipe card to activate the lift. Just another point to remember - I had booked for 3 nights, but the guy at reception was new and only activated my swipe card for 2 nights. Thankfully I noticed this before we left the desk to go to our room. Otherwise - I'm sure there would have been problems so make sure you take 2 copies of your booking print out. As far as location goes - it's great! It's right in front of Centraal Station (look slightly to the left as you walk out). The Red Light District is just behind (far enough so you don't hear the crowd at night) and Daam Square is a 10 minute walk away. However, I was given a room over looking the main road on the second floor. Whilst the view was great - the traffic noise wasn't! They don't have sound proofed windows so make sure you ask for a room that's high up! In summary - this hotel was not what I expect from a 5* standard. Location was superb and the room exceptionally clean. The hotel has some original features too from its ancient times as a palace. However, the traffic noise was a big issue for me. As I was there for only 3 nights and generally very tired after walking all day - I could put up with it. However, I don't think this hotel will be my first choice if I were to visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms overlooking Zeedijk”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Steel
Reviews.Content: Although a fairly basic "5 Star Hotel" the location right next door to the central station is a distinct advantage. Various attractions are within easy walking distance and the trams are always close - HOWEVER - we stayed in room 337 overlooking Zeedijk - lovely during the day but TERRIBLE at night with various louts seeing who could shout the loudest between 1am and 5am each morning. IF YOU WANT TO SLEEP AVOID ROOMS OVERLOOKING ZEEDIJK !!!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic refuge in a sea of history”
Reviews.Author: LaylaKim
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasure to stay at. Right across from Grand Central, you'll not have any trouble finding it. The location is perfect no matter what you want to do as there's buses, bike rental and acces to the canal taxis within two minutes from the hotel. I was pleased with the staff and all the hotel amenities. I found the hair salon and littel weight room to be great and found that I loved coming back after long walks through the bussle to relax and gather more strength. This hotel was immaculate and the room service, while pricey, was very high quality. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. If I'm ever back in Amsterdam, I'll stay at the Barbizon if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: PharmDoc
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel is close to the Central Train Station and traveling by train from the airport and around the city is great from this hotel. There is, however, construction being done around the station making some detours necessary. This hotel is appointed very nicely and the bathroom is much larger than most European hotels. The bath amenities far outweigh most hotels in Europe and the states, but not having working air-conditioning available in a 5 star hotel even if it is April 27th is not acceptable when one pays such a high price. Even opening the one window gave very little relief since our room faced a courtyard. I had better service at a three star hotel a few days later. Even the free breakfast did not match up to any of the other hotels I stayed in during my month stay in Europe. We were very disappointed and would not stay at this hotel again. The price was just not worth the value! I don't care how many bath amenities were given, they are not worth a/c and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - easy to stumble back!”
Reviews.Author: blue_who
Reviews.Content: Given the multitude of vices available in Amsterdam, this hotel is ideal! You can stumble home using any transportation medium - your two feet, the train, tram, canal rides, subway or taxi! The closest hotel to Amsterdam Centraal Station, it has a subway and taxi stop right outside and super attentive bellmen and concierge's who can arrange tickets to just about anything you need (I chose to watch an Ajax Amsterdam soccer match). The rooms are not much to write home about but when on holiday that's the least of my worries. I'm up and out early and back late, so as long as I have a comfortable bed, I'm fine. Probably the best part about the hotel is that it is extremely safe. Located just outside the Red Light District and in the center of all activity, when inside you are cocooned from it all. You do pay a price for the location and the safety though, but in my opinion it's well worth the added expense. There's another NH which seems pretty nice as well, a couple of km down the road, right next to the main square with the year round fair and outdoor eateries. When I'm in Amsterdam next, I'll make sure I try that out as well.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, worth the extra cost”
Reviews.Author: alapal
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews after booking that worried me (5 star or 3 star ??) but it was a really good stay and certainly at UK 4 star level. For a little more than most hotels we got a great room in a tremendous location using their "best available room "offer - it's right next to Central Station and the Canal Bus boats. We didn't use the hotel for anything more than the room as there were so many good restaurants and pubs nearby. We had a minor problem with the booking but it was resolved without any problem. I'd be really happy to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: THP
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic deal from ebookers - 4 nights, flights, breakfast included, tax included - Â£250 each! Went for a romantic break and was not disappointed with the hotel. Strange though - huge bed but 2 small separate duvets... Breakfast was phenomenal - we didn't eat again til late evening. You can even have champagne every day. Location was great but we were unlucky in that many of the major sights were either closed for refurbishment or covered in tarpaulin. I guess that's because we travelled out of season. Did we enjoy ourselves? Yes Would we return to Amsterdam? No -once you've seen the major sights and enjoyed the picturesque canals, there's really not much more to see. One point though - prepare yourself as the guide books warn - the sheer volume of cyclists (and generally appalling lack of care given to pedestrians) is overwhelming. My husband was knocked aside whilst walking on the pavement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAR43
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel, or the Victoria on and off over the past 10 years. Since the renovations were finished its been a lot better but also more expensive. Doing business in the Netherlands is more often than not done by train and the Palace is just a two minute hop from the station for those early morning trains. The rooms are a decent size and are clean. Beware the mini bar: If you take something out of the shelf you're automatically charged whether you put it back or not! Wireless broadband is good throughout the hotel but at 24 euros for 24 hours, is pretty expensive. To be fair that rip off is repeated in hotels everywhere. For business, the hotel is decent mainly because the location is convenient and the rooms hold no surprises. The price is creeping up however. One interesting tip: Around the corner is a really interesting dutch bar: The place is called Cafe Int Aepjen.... Guidebooks describe the place like this: One of the oldest bars in Amsterdam, housed in the only remaining 15th-century home, heavily decorated with old toys and advertising materials. The name means 'In the Monkey', which refers to the time this was a sailors lodging house. When someone couldn't pay his bill he supposedly brought back a monkey on the next trip. What the above doesn't mention is that there is a dutch saying which translates roughly to mean "you've been at the monkey's" denoting bad luck. The monkeys left as payment had fleas...so tenants at the house were always scratching....Also this was a place that press gangs looking for sailors would turn up and shanghai drunken revellers who would wake up the next day on a ship heading to the Dutch East Indies...... Its worth a look. Its the first bar on the left if you exit the hotel from the front and hang a left at the corner. Less than 10 meters away! Warning: The old guy behind the bar can be a bit grumpy. I watched his reaction when asked by a middle aged American woman if she could have a cafe latte.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Facilities, Poor Room Condition”
Reviews.Author: DieselDen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 14th February as a Valentine's treat and paid 150 Euros for a double with breakfast. Unfortunately, the hotel didn't quite live up to its 5* rating. Whilst it comprises several traditional buildings, the facacade that encapsulates them is far from impressive which is a real pity given its location right opposite Central Station. The staff were friendly and efficient. However, upon arriving and being allocated a non-smoking room, our actual room stunk of heavy smoking. A complaint to the hotel resulted in a swift alternative room but not much of an apology. At least this room didn't smell of an ashtray but did share the tired look of the original one - tired furniture, a very tired bathroom and strange separate duvets which made sleeping together "under the cover" impossible even on Valentines night! There was only one bath robe (a bit scratchy too), only one pair of slippers but plenty of free toiletries. However, we were pleasantly surprised with breakfast - a sumptious affair of everything you could fancy and of a very high standard. It was one of the best breakfasts we have ever enjoyed - so much so that we took well over an hour making the most of it. Anyway, a little disappointing but still recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Barbizon Palace and have found it excellent both times. The staff are extremely friendly and actually do attend to your needs. Check in was fast and hassle free. Bizarrely we had the same room on both stays which suited us fine. Despite being a standard room it was on two levels with the toilet downstairs with large storage for clothes, safe etc... The bed was comportable and our room was directly on a canal outside and despite this was quiet. Great location to as we often found ourselves lost in Amsterdam it was easy to get back to the hotel by just heading back towards Central station. On both occasions we managed to get really excellent deals on the rooms so value for money was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jofayerty
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time we've stayed here. It's right opposite Centraal Station, and a 5 minute walk from Dam Square. It's very tastefully decorated and the rooms are small yet comfortable. On the bad side - The Breakfast is not worth 20 Euros each and the residents bar is extortionate. In saying that, I don't travel to Amsterdam to sit in a hotel bar :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: serviceace
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the last couple of years for 4 nights at a time. Booking online we got excellent room rates. The hotel is well situated near to Centraal Station and close to the old town and just outside the red light district although this was never a problem. It is easy to get trains and trams from near the hotel and there are lots of good and inexpensive restaurants in the surrounding streets. On our first visit we were upgraded to a duplex suite - very comfortable and spacious. The second time we were in a standard double which was good if not exceptional. The breakfast was a substantial choice of freshly prepared hot and cold dishes and set us up for the day. We enjoyed both of our stays and would certainly go back to the Barbizon when next in Amsterdam. If you get a good room rate I think it represents a good value for money hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Barbizon Palace”
Reviews.Author: UKSuecee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Barbizon Palace Hotel December 2006 and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is situated opposite Central Station making it very easy to travel to from the airport. The hotel's location is perfect - everything that you would want to see whilst in Amsterdam is within walking distance and believe me you walk everywhere - so comfortable shoes are a must! We had been allocated "the best available room" through Expedia and were not disappointed. Our room was on the 5th floor and was on two levels - the bathroom was on your left when you entered the room and the bedroom was on a lower level, reached by 4 stairs. Our room had a view of the canal and our window also opened which meant you could actually have fresh air in the room. Complimentary tea/coffee is available for you in the room with a kettle. Slippers, bathrobes and an ironing board are also supplied. There is an in-room safe and nice touches such as a book "bedtime stories" which has various stories written by well known authors. Also complimentary toiletries are left for you in the bathroom - shower gel, soaps, moisturiser, tissues and bath/exfoliating mitt. All in all, a great hotel in a great location and one which I would certainly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star, but Very Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: toomanymiles
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location: across from Central Station; an easy walk of 300m. It's on the corner of the Red Light District, fun for tourists, I guess. There's a gin joint at the corner that's a fascinating place with some of the most unusual liquors I've ever had. The hotel is somewhat soulless. The rooms are ok, but make sure you get a non-smoking one if that's what you really want. The Dutch smoke everywhere anyway, and so there are no guarantees. Rooms are usually fairly large, more like Four-Star. Breakfast is expensive, although its variety is good; best to have it in your room plan or go someplace else. The staff is ok, and it's a clean safe place. It's otherwise sterile and lacking much in terms of character. Those that gave it a five star rating are suspect and easily pleased.

Reviews.Title: “What a cool hotel! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ChocNomad74
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we had a horrible travel agent, who booked some extremely backwards flight arrangements, so we arrived at NH Barbizon very exhausted. The NH Barbizon was a PLEASANT surprise! The staff was pleasant and very helpful. The lobby was fabulous. Our room was modern and clean. The hotel hosts one of the best restauarants in Amsterdam, so the breakfast buffett was SUPERIOR!!! The location is close to the metro, shopping, and Central Station. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Amsterdam for the first time. It's near EVERYTHING (wink, wink). We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Barbizon Palace”
Reviews.Author: Tcro
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to Amsterdam in the middle of October, and loved this hotel. It is EXTREMELY convenient, being literally steps from Centraal Station. From here you can get to Schipol airport, the Dutch countryside, or, as we did, other countries (we traveled to Paris from here by train). There are also canal boats that leave from a nearby platform on the canal, and one can easily hop on the tram from here. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and we never felt out of place, despite having very limited knowledge of the Dutch language. Also, we arrived early from a very long overseas flight and had no problem checking in, even though we were at least five hours early. Though we were only on the second floor, facing the street and train station, the room was surprisingly quiet, and the bed was excellent. I slept as well here as in my home! We ordered room service once, and that was excellent as well. Amsterdam is a wonderful, friendly city, and I can't think of a better "home base" for one's stay than the Barbizon palace. I will definitely stay here the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: DonutHole
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times and have booked again for February 2007. We really enjoy this hotel and the Vermeer Restaurant. Some of the rooms are rather small but if they have availability they will change your room. If you don't ask it can't happen. I have never found this hotel to be dirty as some reviewers have stated and although the staff can be somewhat reserved they were never rude. The breakfast buffet is very expensive so unless the breakfast is included in your room price I would suggest you eat elsewhere. The Vermeer is ultra expensive but worth every penny for the elegant dining experience. The location is perfect whether you are traveling on foot or need to take a bus, train or tram. It is a short walk to take a canal cruise. Dam Square is close by as well as the red light district. We found the area to be very safe at night and never had any problems walking. Room service is quick - we used it mainly late in the evening for desserts and in the morning for a pot of coffee before we headed out for the day. While this is considered a business type hotel, many tourists also stay here and yes they do smoke pot in the rooms. Remember folks - you are in Amsterdam!!!!! In Amsterdam you can smell pot while walking down the street. There are many restaurants nearby and they run the gamut from inexpensive to very expensive. There are Thai, Italian, French, Chinese, Japanese, Dutch and everything in between. Amsterdam is a foodies paradise. There is so much to see and do in Amsterdam. We stay here in short spurts (4 to 5 nights) which keeps us coming back year after year. If you travel during the off season you can get some great deals.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: mls1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business. Since the office I was traveling to was in the suburbs of Amsterdam, my company put me at this hotel due to its proximity to the Central Station. The location was very convenient for that reason. However if I were traveling for leisure I would stay elsewhere due to the loud noise and overly crowded streets of the area. The hotel itself was fine, the room was typical of what I have come to expect of European hotels. If you do stay here, I recommend requesting an inside room to avoid the noise. I had a room that faced the outside street and was kept up by partiers in the evening and trash collectors in the morning. And if a New Yorker says this hotel is noisy, it is unbearable as loud noise is a way of life for me. Although some other reviewers have mentioned the sketchy surroundings of the hotel, I never once felt unsafe. I was traveling alone and am in my 20s and never felt threatened at all. I grew up and live in New York City so I am very used to large cities and this one felt very safe to me.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: Celticx
Reviews.Content: Typical Dutch hotel, 5 stars, would be lucky for 2 stars in the UK or Ireland, the lobby is a dark lifeless area and the rooms are in need of a major refurbishment .overall not alot to say about this hotel so i think that sums it up no lasting memories.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it. Loud Location. Watch out for misc. billing.”
Reviews.Author: Florida.Girl.2006
Reviews.Content: I just completed a stay at the Barbizon that lasted about ten days. I was there for work and will request not to stay in the same hotel again. The rooms are fine. If you can get a good rate, it may be worth staying there. I would recommend The Grand (Sofitel) and the regular Sofitel over this hotel in a minute if you have your choice. Rooms: Rooms are fine. The online pictures are accurate. The bed is okay but not above and beyond (like the beds at the Sofitel hotels). Location: The location is in a very busy area of town. Amsterdam is not a big city in terms of getting around. So, there is no need to worry about being right in the center of town.
