Also, I found this location to be too loud and too close to the sketchy areas of town. Laundry: Dry cleaning is prompt. Laundry -- be careful what you send. They ruined something of mine. Billing problems: First, another person with whom I work and myself had a problem with calling cards. I used a calling card and she used her credit card to make calls from the phone. We both expected to be charged the 3.5 Euros for making a call. However, we did not expect to be billed for the entire duration of the call. The hotel could not explain what had happened accurately. I complained and finally half of the charges were removed. Additionally, someone from our group had problems with the mini bar. If you take something out to look at it, after a few seconds a charge for that item is included on your bill. There is no notice of this that any of us noticed. She questioned her bill as well and they finally removed part of the charge. I would be careful and keep track of your charges if you are coming here. Staff: The front desk was not overly pleasant (which they should be if this is a five star hotel). Everyone else working the front door, taking your luggage, etc. was really nice. I do not wish to stay here again. So, if there is nothing available this hotel is okay. But, for the advertised rates, you can do much better in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: I_need_a_hols
Reviews.Content: This is a three star hotel with a Conran shop make over in reception, but dingy motorway hotel rooms and over the top prices. Only plus point is location. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel would recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Exellent hotel would recommend to anyone going to amsterdam. This hotel is ina prime location opposite the central station so no taxi to get to it just 5 minutes walk. Lovely decor inside marble floors etc. We stayed in room 401 which was like a loft room the biggest hotel room i have ever stayed in. Would go back there tomorrow loved it nothing bad i can say about this hotel it had everything in the room even robes and slippers. The staff were friendly and it even has a coniserge definitely a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - central location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbizon Paslace for 3 nights in April and had a wonderful time. We had flown all day from the States and so the sauna was a welcomed relief the following day. Our room was large with high-beamed ceilings. The staff was helpful and courteous. The bar was a cool retreat with gourmet appetizers. Location was centrally located and very convenient. We had some delicious dinners in near by restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Barbizon Palace was very convenient”
Reviews.Author: historytraveller
Reviews.Content: The Barbizon was very pleasant and conveniently located. The staff was friendly and the concierge service was excellent - recommendations for restaurants and diamond factory were great. Our room was right on the canal and it was charming, although a little small and the furnishings were a little worn. However, when we expressed concern about the condition of a chair in our room, it was immediately replaced. The bathroom was very clean and updated. We did not use the mini-bar or any of the other services that involve extra charges. The other couple we travelled with found that a breakfast had been charged to their room in error, but they were able to get the charge removed without a problem. Overall, the stay was very enjoyable. We would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service for a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: mnck
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a 5 star; I checked in with a Priceline winning bid and they claimed they had no records and wanted to bill my credit card;luckily I had my Priceline receipt and gave them a copy; they tried billing me again midway through my stay and again when I checked out; luckily I had printed copies of my Priceline receipt and AMEX payments and I refused to pay for a stay that was all pre-paid through Priceline...watch out, these Europeans are cheats and think US tourists can be suckers!!! Next time I'll stay at a Marriott or Hilton USA hotel!! No heat working... for a 5 star; sent me a portable heater after 2 days of freezing at 19C!! Stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not 5-Star”
Reviews.Author: NWSongbird
Reviews.Content: There for a business trip, I was excited to stay in a 5-star hotel for the first time. In the future, I will opt for a less expensive hotel - the experience was definitely not worth the price tag. The rooms are small, which is the norm for European hotels. I was hoping, based on the rating, that they would have done something to update the insulation - sadly, no. I literally could hear the person in the next room peeing - I am not making this up. All of the "services" (phone, laundry, wireless internet, room service, restaurants, etc.) were absurdly expensive - as an example, the buffet breakfast was 20 Euro per person! Room components (furniture, appliances, linens, etc.) were average - nothing anywhere near luxurious. Despite being an upscale business hotel, my hallway reeked of pot smoke on more than one evening. I realize it's Amsterdam, but I didn't expect that in a business hotel. The up-sides to the hotel are the location (across from central station and an easy walk from all downtown attractions) and the staff who were on the whole friendly and helpful. All in all, while I'm not sure how they got the rating, I felt like they simply used it as an excuse to run you dry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: iluvjamaica
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for 2 weeks. After a lot of research we decided on the Barbizon Palace and I'm glad we did! The location is perfect. Right across the street from Central Station, the tourist info center and the canal taxi pickup. The day we arrived it was raining and very cold. We arrived at 7am so our room was not ready. The hotel staff was very gracious and found us a room by noon even though check in wasn't until 3pm. We were on the 4th floor facing Central Station. The room was very nice. It included a safe (no charge) and mini bar. Be aware that if you choose to use the mini bar in this hotel you will pay through the nose. We went to the convenience store 2 doors down from the hotel to buy our drinks, munchies, etc... and kept ice in the room. If you remove anything from the fridge to place your items in there (even if you don't eat/drink it) you will be charged so be advised. There is an excellent sandwich shop on the corner as well that sells a real cup of coffee (Americans like BIG coffees which were hard to find) as well as excellent deli sandwiches. The price was right too. This hotel offers currency conversion, a buffet breakfast that was included with price of the room, and excellent concierge service. It is a beautiful hotel that sits among some of the oldest buildings in Amsterdam. When you walk out the front door and turn to your left you are about 20 steps away from the Red Light District. We considered the Grand Kransnapolsky and were very glad we didn't stay there because it sits right on the Dam in the middle of the Red Light District and looked pretty scary at night. Lots of drunk, high, shady looking people. We didn't see any of that around our hotel. It took us a couple of days to figure out the phones there. Buy a 5 Euro phone card (ours was green with what looked like a computer chip in the end) and use the green phones by Central Station. To some this may seem like a no brainer but we were ripped off by a salesperson that told us we needed a card we did not (20 Euros worth!) and ended up bringing it home as a souviner! Beware! You don't need more than 5 Euros at a time. We called the states several times and only had to buy 2 of them for the entire 2 weeks. Be sure the use the trams-they take you everywhere and save your feet. We bought the Amsterdam Pass and it saved us some money. It also included a canal cruise that was awesome! You can purchase day trips at the tourist center outside of Central Station and they were worth every penny. Much cheaper to buy them there. We were glad we didn't purchase them ahead of time with the package. Exchange your currency there, not in the US or you get robbed. We took 100 Euros that we got in the US and used our ATM cards after we got there. We carried no more than 50 Euros on us at a time. Watch out for the people selling things in the flea markets. Check your change! They tried to rip us off 3 times by giving us currency from other countries. Great deals though! You can't help but notice they see Americans as an easy mark. Be Aware! The museums are fantastic and not to be missed. We found the society there as a whole to be facinating and very open minded. We met a lot of nice people and we met some not so nice people but that happens no matter where you go. Ladies, you will wish you had taken an empty suitcase when you see the prices of the designer clothing, shoes and handbags! I could not believe how cheap. I bought 2 pair of leather boots for 50 Euros each that would have easily been over $200 in the US. Great selection, great prices. If you want to bring home cheese, forget it. Best to just ship it home and don't even try to bring it on the plane. We saw a lot of people held up at customs because of cheese and chocolate. They say if it's sealed in tin or foil there are no problems but from what we saw, I wouldn't risk it-mail it home. We loved the hotel and the city and hope to return someday (with my empty suitcase).

Reviews.Title: “New Year at the Barbizon”
Reviews.Author: cwagsg
Reviews.Content: Firstly, if you ever get the chance to go to Amsterdam for New Year - go!! What an atmosphere. Just remember to book a table for dinner well in advance. Anyway - the hotel. I loved it! Our room was a standard. It was a good size, spotlessly CLEAN. How anyone could say ths hotel is dirty is beyond me. Staff were friendly and courteous at all times. Our breakfast was included, although it is expensive to buy if you are room only. Although the food was absoutley superb! Having stayed at the Krasnapolsky, I would say that the Barbizon is the poor relation, but only just!!! In short, if you like good quality, good service, clean and comfortable rooms - stay here. If you want a slightly nicer location, stay at Krasnapolsky or the Doelen which is nearer Rembrandtsplein. I don't think I would rate this hotel a 5 star, but certainly worthy of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean, shabby condition, definitely not a palace”
Reviews.Author: jfive
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the freshly blood-stained sheets on the bed that I found in my room when I arrived. After complaining about this, the staff (who were very helpful) were appalled and changed the bed immediately, but the next day the hotel's manager accused me of concocting the story. Next time I find bloody sheets on a bed in a hotel, I'll take photos and post them here. Also, Wifi is expensive at all NH hotels, including this one. Breakfast is 24 Euros! Condition of the public areas and elevators are dreary and not clean. The palace needs a remodel. All who read these reviews should take them with a grain of salt. I can't believe anyone would find this hotel appealing.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggirl
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, all the staff were very friendly.The food was great and quite resonably priced.The barman made everyone really welcome (made some brilliant cocktails).We arrived about 9'o'clock in the morning and they took us yo our room straight away although book in time was not until the afternoon. The rooms were nice, clean and warm, although we did not spend a great deal of time in them.The hotel is situated central to everything most things are within walking distance.When I go back to amsterdam I will be staying there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: PedroREIS
Reviews.Content: As you would expect from a NH Hotel, everything is up to perfection. The location is superb, not only in terms of getting to the airport but also because the Dam, with its nearby restaurants and souvenir shops is 5 minutes away. Anne Frank's house is 20 minutes away. Not surprisingly, my room was upgraded when I checked in. I was given an absolutely massive room with astonishing views to the Centraalstation. Just to give you an idea, there were two levels in this room: one for the bathroom and the upper one for the bed, desk, tv, etc. The reason why I aforesaid not surprisingly is because at NH they always find a way to please you. Breakfast is well worth it. For 20 euros you get a combination of breads, homemade cakes, a variety of cheese, ham and butter, fruit, different natural juices, the regular coffee and milk and, last but not the least, champagne (not sparkling wine, I mean real champagne). You can have a all bottle of bubbly for breakfast if you're in the mood. I had a huge breakfast during my stay and ended up no having lunch at all. It's a shame I can only rate this hotel as excellent because it is certainly a lot more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: spanner42
Reviews.Content: Read a few reviews about this hotel, and wasn't quite sure what to expect. Travelling alone and booking a single room I feared the worst, but was more that happy with this hotel From checking in (earlier than the required check in time), to checking out, all I can say is It is definitley on my list to return to. All the staff were pleasant, friendly and efficient, nothing was too much trouble, the room was great, and the hotel motto about wanting to be a home from home was well deserved. I was a bit concerned having read about some of the rooms being noisy, but although I was at the back of the hotel over looking a canal with an Irish Pub and a hotel on the other bank, it was fine. The dressing gown and slippers etc were nice, but what was truly great for me was not only was there a kettle, there was adequate tea and coffee supplies. There was a comfy chair and footstool - they even provided some bed time reading - I am definitley a fan of this place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!! Wow”
Reviews.Author: lesta_boy
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this hotel is that go there, a top hotel!! Perfect location, right opposite the train station, a few minutes walk, walking distance to everything, go around the corner and all the shops are there, cafe's and restaurants. The staff were so nice and friendly, we arrived at the hotel at 10:30 am, they let us check-in! Wow, it definitely is a 5* star hotel, the towels, bath robes, the bed time story book next to the bed!!! Slippers, they even gave me a nice little silver frame as a gift, and it was not my birthday, where do you get that service these days? The toiletries in the room were so nice, the tv was great, the nice big room, cupboards inside, and we were not even in a suite! I would definitely recommend this hotel, have stayed at many in my life, but this hotel is fab, when I go back definitely staying at the Barbizon Palace!! The only problem is you have to pay 12 Euros for the gym/healt club facilities, this should be complimentary for guests, but nevermind, still a perfect hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Well placed”
Reviews.Author: A2TMFK
Reviews.Content: Before I went out to amstedam I looked through Tripadvisor at the reviews for all the 5* hotels in central Amsterdam. I chose the Barbizon Palace because of its location and through what I read, here. The location is excellent - accross from central station to the left - so not on the noisy, busy crowded Damrak. The check in was effortless and I asked for a smoking room with a view out front. The room was spacious and well equipped - although I couldn't open the window - which in a smoking room is important! so they moved me next door without any hassle. I heard some people complaining that the front of the hotel was too noisy - I wouldn't know as I was never in till after midnight. I did not dine at the hotel as there are so many good eats out there to enjoy. I paid 120 euros per night (3 nights in total). I thought that was well worth the money and I would definately go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can be very noisy”
Reviews.Author: richraj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights this month. The hotel is in an excellent location when arriving by train, only a short walk from Central Station. Also, great for the attractions in the centre area. Be warned there is major construction work around the station. The hotel reception staff are excellent, when we arrived I asked for a quiet location, and although the hotel was heavily booked they spent sometime looking at what they could do for us. They eventually upgraded us to a deluxe room at no extra charge. The rooms are what you would expect in an 4/5 star hotel, with all the usual facilities. Very comfortable beds. Although I think calling it a 5 star hotel is being a bit generous. Our biggest problem was the noise in the street below our room, which was located on the 4th floor at the rear of hotel. The street had a large amount of bars and clubs and the shouting and singing went on until 3.00 in the morning. And considering we asked for a quiet room it was unbelievable. Also the room was heavily double glazed, and that didn't deaden the noise!! Being near the red light district it obviously attracted many guys on stag nights/weekends. I can't fault the hotel, only the location which is very noisy. Probably when the hotel was built there was not the problem of drunken young people, but unfortunately it is now common in city centres.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davey102001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel the last week of July 2005. The hotel is situated over the road from Central Station. The location is just perfect for getting around Amsterdam. The hotel is extremely stylish and the rooms are just pefect with absolutely everything you need and the most comfortable beds. The rooms are cleaned and everything replenished on a daily basis - you even get a mint on your pillow each day. Shoe shine facilities and ice machines are situated on each floor with an ice bucket provided in your room for you to fill up. The staff are most friendly, very welcoming and helpful. Check-in is 3.00 p.m., however, we arrived at approximately 11.00 a.m. and they stored our luggage and had our rooms ready for about 1.30 p.m. If you travel to Amsterdam from the airport by train (very cheap and frequent) all you need to do is come out of Central Station - look to your left across the road and you will see the welcoming sign of the Barbizon Palace. We will be going back to Amsterdam soon and will without hesitation be staying in this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: bojomania
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of July 9th 2005. I was not very happy. We were supossed to stay at the NH Krasnapolsky however they were overbooked and sent us to the Barbizon Palace. The reason we booked the Krasnapolsky was to be away from the central station and the construction work and to be away from the red light district but ended up there since the Barbizon is across from the station and a small road next to it leads to the Red Light District. Our booking was also messed up, they had us in a smaller room than requested, service was less than par and the price in my opinion far to high for the quality of the hotel. We paid 198 euro/night for a very small room that needed some work. We also couldn't check in until 5PM, 3 hours past the normal check in time b/c of all the disorganization. Perhaps I am most disapointed since we didn't choose the Barbizon but were forced to stay there since the hotel had overbooked guests. To make up for it they offered us a drink at the bar....water or a soft drink (no alcohol....)and a gift, a cheap looking toiletry bag....for a hotel that claims it is 5 stars, it was a pretty sad gift. I won't be staying at an NH hotel again, my experience was extremely disapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, it is important to remember that 5 star in the US and 5 star in Amsterdam mean 2 very different things. That said, this hotel is an excellent value for the location, and has an even better staff. Our room (1 King Bed on the 3rd floor) was a converted loft space, complete with exposed beams and the old hoisting wheel in the ceiling. Three large windows looked out to the neighboring street where restuarants and bars abound. The bathroom was clean and basic, with towels refreshed nightly. The room had a smallish feel to it, but handled our clothes and luggage just fine. There was one small chair and table. This was not a room to spend a significant time lounging about in. The hotel staff is impressive. Friendly, knowledgable, and more than accomodating. The concierge was excellent - giving hnest and candid feedback about restuarants and activites we were considering. Every request made of staff was filled promptly and with a smile. The hotel is across from the Central Train Station and just borders the Red Light District. You are about a 10 minute walk from both Dam Square and the Jordaan - about a 25 minute walk to the Leidesplein. The tram system, centrally located across the street at the train station, makes getting around the city both easy on the feet and quick - if you don't want to walk. We will definitely stay there again. We spent 3 nights in very comfortable surroundings - but don't anticipate 5 star elegance a la the Ritz in NY - you simply will not find it here.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Barbizon Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, Amsterdam 1012 AD, The Netherlands (Formerly Golden Tulip Barbizon Palace)
